Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Bigblue22
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with addressing the review before mine and say that it must have been written by one of those unfortunate people who are impossible to please, because to give this hotel 1 star is beyond comprehension. I stayed here with my girlfriend for the second time and again we absolutely loved our visit. The hotel is charming, the staff (especially Kelly) is one of the most bubbly and wonderful people I have ever met. She gave us some great suggestions and went out of her way to ensure that we were the most comfortable we could be. This hotel has become a traditional stop on our yearly Northern California swing and will continue to be for a long long time. I would suggest each night having warm chocolate chip cookies and wine in the beautiful courtyards hot tub. Totally romantic and delicious. Thank you again to Kelly and the rest of the Elm House staff. We will see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowerbuyer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Elm House Inn in Napa. We were greeted by friendly staff, who offered to help us with our luggage (!). I was a bit concerned because our room opened directly onto the breakfast area, and thought it would be noisy, especially in the morning. It was very quiet, and we heard no noise at all. The room was very clean, there are two sink/vanity areas-one inside the bath, and one just outside the bath, which to me is a real plus. The breakfast was very nice, and included hot made-to-order waffles, a lovely assortment of fresh fruit, yogurts, cold and hot cereals, hard boiled eggs, pastries, bagels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Went Elswhere after One Night”
Reviews.Author: 1Riverman1
Reviews.Content: First of all, the picture on the Trip Advisor site is not the Elm House Inn. We were booked for 4 nights and left after a most uncomfortable sleep the first night. I should have been smart enough to spot it when we checked in, but I did not. The bed had two major indentations running from top to bottom where people have slept. I felt like I was in a trench and awoke with a sore back. While the girl at the desk offered us another room, she said she had spoken to the owner and he told her all of the mattresses were the same. This inn is also on a major road and from about 4:30 a.m. on the noise from the traffic kept me awake. As this is California, there is no need for double pane or insulated windows, so there was nothing to keep the traffic noise out of the room. I had no difficulty from them canceling the rest of my booking and we moved on to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, perfect for a romantic trip!”
Reviews.Author: demayumi
Reviews.Content: I and my husband were in honeymoon in Napa and we've stayed only for one night at this hotel. The building is really charming, with a great hall/dining room and an open green area. The room is really comfortable, well furnished and with a fireplace. The breakfast is excellent, with fresh choices, you can also order pancakes and eggs. After 5pm homemade cookies and drinks are offered to the guests. Our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Could not believe this was a Best Western! Great value in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: cologirl20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Napa Valley in over Presidents' Day weekend in February of 2011 (I wrote a review then, but it did not get posted for some unknown reason). So here is the "abbreviated" version of that review: This is a great little inn if you are visiting Napa Valley and want to save a little money to put toward wine-tasting experiences and meals rather than expensive accommodations. We spent our days out and about, so we didn't want to spend a small fortune on a bed, but we wanted someplace comfortable, clean, and well-maintained. Overall, the Elm House fit the bill. Our room was spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was huge, which was nice but not entirely necessary. The shower was almost too big and didn't have a door, so it was hard to stay warm while showering, which during a rainy February weekend would have been nice. I don't remember our room number, but we had to go out through the very small courtyard past the closed hot tub to get to our ground level room. (I put those details in there because though the courtyard is cute, don't expect something huge, and the hot tub was not open the weekend we were there.) It was nice, quiet, and warm in the room, and there were some comfy chairs to relax in when desired. I love bed and breakfast-type places because I hate having to hunt for a meal first thing in the morning when I travel, but that's just me. The breakfast room is comfortable, but it is not big enough for the guests that come to dine in the morning. We could not figure out an ideal time to go to breakfast because it always seemed busy. Some people had to wait awhile to get an open table. The breakfasts were tasty, and I felt like they had something to suit just about everyone. The staff worked hard overall. As we sat at breakfast each morning, I noticed that several rooms are right off the breakfast area/lobby (it's all one big room really). I made a mental note that should we return to Napa and the Elm House, I need to specifically request NOT to be placed in one of these rooms because I would not like the noise that guests staying in those rooms would no doubt have to hear. It is not located in a particularly scenic part of town, but there is easy access to the main road going through Napa for our wine excursions. (If you're looking for a wine tasting tour company, we used Platypus Tours and loved our guide and the wineries she took us too--we joined one of the winery's wine clubs!) Overall, I have to say that we were pleased with our stay at the Best Western Elm House. We felt that it was a good value for what we got: a nice room, comfortable place to sleep, reasonably good service, and a good breakfast each morning. I think we would very likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet but room could've been better.”
Reviews.Author: Shmaffle
Reviews.Content: This B&B is very sweet. The owners and staff are excellent - very friendly and helpful, not to mention hard working. The breakfast was great; so nice for us to be able to get a proper cup of English tea and eat a healthy breakfast with fresh fruit, cereal and toast. Cookies in the afternoon are yummy. Laundry facility if needed. Hot tub. Out door seating. Free parking. Unfortunately, our room was very dark and a tad dismal. We were on the ground floor in a corner and the room didn't seem to get much light. I'm sure if was perfectly clean but the room did look a bit dated. All in all, it's a very good B&B for a good price but perhaps request a room on a higher floor. About a 15 minute walk to down town Napa which was perfect for us. Recommend the Napa Wine train. A great way to see the valley and the staff are very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CalGal07
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and booked the hotel upon other travelers reviews. I called and booked directly with the hotel. I requested a early check in at noon since I was running the Silverado half marathon in the morning and needed to shower before wine tasting. I was informed that we could check in at noon. Needless to say, when we arrived, we were told that check in was at 3 pm. They read our booking which stated that early check in was requested at noon.We were informed check in was at 3 pm they would call us when a room was ready. At noon the hotel was empty and not a car in the lot. As we walked back to our car, many of the rooms had their windows open and looked clean & ready for check in. The hotel is not walking distance to downtown Napa and is located by the highway so we drove to find an outdoor cafe. After waiting an hour & a half we returned to the hotel without receiving a phone call. Upon arriving the second time we were told " oh I was going to call you". By the time we showered and drove to the wineries it was 4 pm. We missed a day of wine tasting. The hotel should tell all guests of their policy of no check in before 3 pm. If we were giving this information we would have stayed where.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, friendly, spacious”
Reviews.Author: coolsack
Reviews.Content: This is is a lovely, lovely place. The independently owned Best Western affiliate is not like any chain hotel. A lovely garden, a warm and helpful welcome by staff and owners alike(including fresh baked cookies and tea), a pleasant breakfast room, generous room well kept make the overall gestalt of this place very special. The owners are a model of how to run a hotel: generous to guests and clearly caring about their staff, the feeling here is all about California warmth. I have stayed in fancier places, but none nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bloo207husky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this inn for two nights, and found it to be exceptional. The room was large, clean, private, and without noise. The garden area was charming as well as the outdoor patio and indoor breakfast room. Food was delicious, and the warm early evening chocolate chip cookies were divine. Inn owners and staff really take pride in accommodating their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeAndTheLittleWoman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. The hotel and grounds are attractive, our room was comfortable, the service was excellent and the breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kg22
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this inn. We arrived close to 11 pm after delayed flights from MA and HI. The pm manager was very helpful. After a long day of travel, we were welcome to use the hot tub. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast room was comfortable. Lots of breakfast choices. Great location for a base in Napa for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Marc V
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place, everything was perfect: cozy room, delicicious breakfast, extremely friendly staff. The best place we stayed on our trip to the West!

Reviews.Title: “One word ... fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 123California123
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, the room was lovely, the beds were cozy and the staff were without a doubt the friendliest we met on our vacation. The breakfast was lovely and in general it was a fantastic hotel and i would definately recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “most pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: oncesouthernbelle
Reviews.Content: wanting to get in a quick trip before i have surgery, we planned at the last minute & were lucky enough to find space here. everything was perfect. the "continental breakfast" is NOT your typical cereal & cold danish event. THERE ARE BELGIAN WAFFLES cooked to order, hard cooked eggs, toast or bagels toasted up as you wish, coffee cakes (homemade) that are to die for. and if you want some to go...no problem. the coffee was excellent as well. our room was in "the annex" upstairs & was huge. there's a separate vanity area in the walkin closet that was so nice for dressing while one of us showered. space galore. and very comfortable bed & bedding, windows for fresh air & a lovely garden view. (two of these rooms face the street, so be sure & ask if you want garden.) it's located at the edge of a residential district, not in a commercial area, but very convenient to get to the commercial areas. the host could not have been more accommodating & cheerful. a very positive vibe there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Symmesgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights recently. It is the number one hotel in Napa listed on this website so we gave it a try. We arrived very late the first night. There was one lady at the desk and she knew who I was since we were the last people to check in that night. We had to park on the street since their lots were full. I was told by a reviewer to ask for the newer building. I got two calls from the inn before we arrived to say that the room we wanted on the first floor was already booked. I thought that was very nice of them to call us. We took the second floor room. There are a bunch of stairs and it's outside so we had to lug our big suitcases up ourselves. I was told that we could have help with them but we arrived so late that we did it ourselves. The room itself was very large. it also had another sink area in addition to the bathroom which made it nice. There were also plenty of towels. There was also free internet. The mattress was very soft and we like a firm one. The breakfast was very nice. They offered to make you waffles which we had one of the mornings. They were very good. They had some kind of fresh baked sweet each morning such as orange cranberry bread. At 6 pm they put out fresh baked cookies. We got there at 6:15 each night and there were hardly any cookies left. They also have 2 for 1 tasting coupons for some of the Napa wineries (but not for Sonoma wineries) in a box in the lobby. The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel is located right off the highway and it's easy to get around to Napa or Sonoma from there. We had a very nice stay there. It's not luxurious though. I'm sure that there are other hotels and inns in the area that are more luxurious but you'll pay a lot more for them. I also heard people say that the hotels in Napa seem to be better priced than those further north in places like Yountville or St. Helena.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BillyRedMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure this should be classified as a hotel because it really isn't very big. This has more of a feel of a B&B but will all the privacy of your own hotel room. The breakfast was outstanding! Both young ladies that helped serve were extremely friendly. The small almond loaf (which was warm) was outstanding. My wife and I traveled with my sistern and her husband and she said the oatmeal bar was the best she has seen. If we ever go back to Napa we will definitely stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy hotel in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Catsmama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Elm House Inn for 5 nights with my mother and my sister. The hotel stuff was very friendly, helpful and have lots of knowledge around the area. Breakfast was superb. Loved their Belgian waffle! I chose this hotel because of all the rave reviews and didn't regret it. However, there were several things I would like to point out about this hotel. Although the room was clean and cozy, I thought the mattress was not the best to sleep on. The other thing was noise level. Because this hotel was located at the busy street, expect to hear some traffic noise from outside especially when you stay at the ground level. The noise was bothering my mom and my sister and we found on the 3rd day that the both of our windows were 1/4 open. Did the cleaning lady open the window and forgot about closing it? It is not only noisy but also not safe! Luckily, nothing had happened to our belongings. Also, there was some dripping noise outside when it rained. (this problem was solved by the owner right away.) Overall, this hotel was very cozy, homey, friendly place with reasonable price. If you want to have a cozy B&B feeling place to stay, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE WE STAYED AT ON OUR WHOLE TRIP”
Reviews.Author: JimboVancouver
Reviews.Content: As others have stated this feels more like an intimsate B&B than a hotel. The rooms are great! Tom and his staff make you feel welcome from check-in thru to check-out. Tom is the consumate inn-keeper calling his guests by name and showing real concern for their comfort and needs. The breakfast is much more than the usual continental. We took ours on the outdoor patio which even in January was comfortable (with the patio heaters). The chocolate chip cookies in late afternoon, are a nice treat! Grap them when you see them because the other guests snap them up. I can not wait until we get to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced B&B in otherwise uber-expensive Napa...”
Reviews.Author: Sazelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House Inn for two nights, March 29 & 30th of 2012. This was the second trip to Napa that my husband and I have taken, and we decided to go for more cozy, economical lodgings (last time we stayed at the Napa River Inn, you may read my review on its Trip Advisor page as well). After our sticker-shock at such places as Harvest Inn, etc. we settled on the Elm House. We were skeptical, it being a Best Western and us having had mixed experiences with those, however what convinced us was it's #1 rating on this site, and the raving reviews of the breakfast. Well, I'm not so sure I'd rate it quite as high as #1, but certainly above Napa River Inn--rooms are a tad small, decor and furnishings are dated--however the breakfast is truly fantastic. The ladies in the kitchen will gladly make you a Belgian waffle or toast any of the assorted breads for you. There are always hard-boiled eggs, fruit and usually yogurt and hot oatmeal (as well as coffee and juice) available. Best part, breakfast is complimentary (they have a small tip jar by the coffee, since they clean up your table for you) so load up and then head out to the wineries! If you keep in mind that this is more of a bed and breakfast, with a lived-in, homey feel, you will not be disappointed, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bernardosw
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Napa. Besides being really close to the highway (without any noise) it is a very comfortable and warm feeling place to stay. Our room had a nice fireplace and the bed was very comfortable. We had a great night of sleep and I wished I could have stayed longer. Staff is very friendly and provided us with a lot of information about the area. They'll also cook your breakfast in the morning offering some nice and tasty options like homemade waffles. Our stay here was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Combine12
Reviews.Content: Great inn and breakfast for the price, large rooms and comfy lounge chairs, good breakfast daily, walk to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Personal B & B like service”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to the wine country and so I consulted Trip Advisor for a Hotel. The Elm House was rated #1 and wow! not a disappointment! The manager/owner helped us plan our entire weekend. The afternoon treat was a great pick-me-up after a long drive and the breakfast was the best I have ever had at a complementary continental breakfast by a hotel. The waffles were made to order and amazing! The room was CLEAN, updated and very comfortable. The bed made for a great nights sleep! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Review Steered Us In Right Direction!”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaC411
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I decided to spend some time in Napa Valley, we looked to Trip Advisor for our hotel choice. We were surprised to see a Best Western entry listed on top, but I am happy to say I could not agree more with the ranking. We arrived early in the day, knowing check in time was later in the day. The desk clerk was so helpful, providing us with a map of the area, directions, and even offered us muffins and coffee before we headed into Napa Valley. She also offered to call us as soon as our room was ready. After a long afternoon in the wine country, we returned to the hotel and the day just got better. We were assigned to a very quiet room with a fireplace, AND found two wine glasses ready for our use! At 6:00 p.m., we smelled the aroma of fresh baked cookies from our hallway! We enjoyed a cookie before we left for dinner and found more hot cookies (and milk) upon our return! Breakfast the next morning was just as wonderful. There were a variety of cereals (hot and cold), fruits, breads, and hot waffles cooked to order. All were served by a very kind staff. My only hesitation about posting this review is that others will discover the Elm House Inn and they will be booked next time we head to the wine country!

Reviews.Title: “B & B feel at a Best Western price”
Reviews.Author: Nole711
Reviews.Content: Alrighty, folks. I am a big time bed bug hypochondriac and have diagnosed OCD. I do not like traveling because I must do a thorough inspect of the rooms I stay in before I even bring my suitcase inside a room. Well, my sister and I recently chose the Elm House for our trip to Napa/Sonoma. I'm so glad we did! I inspected the room with my LED flashlight and everything was super, super clean. The housekeepers also did a great job at cleaning daily. We kept very expensive jewelry out since there was no safe and nothing was stolen (that's always a plus!) The free cookies were great but they have nuts which my sister is allergic too. The free breakfast is great too. They had boiled eggs, cereals, juice, milk, yogurt, fruit, waffles, and an assortment of fresh baked breads (which unfortunately also all had nuts on all four days we stayed-caution to those w/ nut allergies. They need to warn people!) Other than the nut craze in every thing we came in contact with (food wise) at this hotel, everything was superb. We stayed in room 403 and loved it. It was away from all the huss and fuss of the "main house" is how I could describe it. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here and was quite shocked at how nice everyone was. We're from Miami and it scared me a little. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Top-rated hotel - for good reason”
Reviews.Author: Jeff J
Reviews.Content: We chose this because it was the top-rated hotel in the Napa area. The reviewers were right, and we were completely satisfied in all respects (except that we didn't use the pool, as it was still closed for the winter, so have not rated that). The location is perfect, service was excellent, the room was very comfortable (including the gas fireplace, which compensated for the mattress being not quite perfect for us, though still quite good), the breakfasts are great (with a wide variety to choose from including delicious Belgian waffles made to order), and the cookies in the evening are amazing! We will definitely go back when we visit Napa again.

Reviews.Title: “Cross between an inn and a Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eonny
Reviews.Content: Quaint, clean, great base for winery visits. We were upgraded to a king in the back section, second floor. Some complain of road noise, but even closer to the road it won't be bad. Breakfasts are continental, I had the oatmeal, no eggs, but you could have waffles made for you. Coffee and cookies out all day. About one mile from the Oxbow Public Market, worth a trip. If you are not sure what wineries to visit check with the front desk, they have brochures and coupons. Ask about picking up the Silverado Trail to Conestoga then take route 29 back. The Petrified Forest is worth a look see, I am told the geyser is a waste of time. No pool, but a hot tub, didn't use. Free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “A great value--wish we could've stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: kwippy
Reviews.Content: This was a very darling place to stay. The pictures don't really do this place justice; the service was courteous, the cookies were delectable and the continental breakfast was one of a kind in tastiness and simplicity. If you're looking for a posh five star resort, keep searching, but if you want some place simple, affordable and quaint, this is a great place. The front desk employee suggested a wonderful place for dinner (Grace's Table) which left us stuffed and seeing stars at the end of the night (it was that good!) We were happy to retire to our room after a long day of touring Sonoma and Napa Valley!

Reviews.Title: “Cousy, small, personalised service”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBR
Reviews.Content: Very few rooms at an old house makes this hotel very charming and cousy. Breakfast is great, with many options. Spent only one day but could feel personal service, including the owner. We were lucky enough to catch a complimentary fresh baked cookies plate, which were absolutely delicious! Even after departure, owner answered my email contact trying to help me finding missing cardigan. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Csites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House for 3 nights. We stayed in the cottage outside the main hotel. It was simply beautiful. We had a full bathroom and then a 2nd area with a mini-fridge and sink. The bed was big and comfortable and a nice large TV. There was a coffee maker and always a couple of clean wine glasses in the room and robes (which is always a wonderful surprise.) When we checked in, they gave us a lot of great information about the area, had coupons for wine tasting, had a book of menus of local restaurants and made dinner reservations for us. It was really great customer service! The location was terrific for seeing both Napa and Sonoma! The breakfast is adequate and there are always warm cookies and milk in the evening. There is also a small hot tub. We didn't have our swimsuits so didn't use it, but it looked very clean! We highly recommend this place and would stay here again if we are ever in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Yep, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cgwonvaca
Reviews.Content: The reviews are true, the owners of this place know how to make you feel right at home. We arrived early, rolling it at 9:30 to catch a 10:30 start to a wine tour. Despite the afternoon check-in time, we were welcomed right in and directed toward the free breakfast (which featured this amazing, still-warm blueberry pastry). The owners gave us great advice about how to spend our first trip to the area. And yes, the afternoon cookies are wicked good.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Yoko-NV
Reviews.Content: All we can do is echo the other superlatives that have already been aired....great location, exceptional breakfast, cozy, comfortable rooms and bathrooms, marvelous staff and an incredible price value

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris100cr
Reviews.Content: A great hotel that hasn't lost it's charm being part of a larger hotel chain. As there are not many rooms the service which the staff were able to offer was great. If you are a light sleeper I'd reccomend requesting a room facing the rear, or in the annex as the road can be a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: maxthecat65
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a couple of days in Napa during our week stay in Santa Rosa and I wanted to stay somewhere cozy. After reading the reviews I picked Elm House and we are glad I did. Everyone was awesome. The breakfast was great, you must have a waffle! We got the room we requested with the fireplace. We were also celebrating our 3rd wedding anniversary and everyone wished us well. Would stay again on another trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bluesman7408
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 days touring the Napa Valley / Sonoma region and to come back to the Elm House Inn every night was just a dream! They make cookies in the evening that will bust anyone's diet and their breakfast is extensive and should satisfy all palates. The owners of the property still run the place and it shows in their attention to the details. I've already made a booking for the same time next year! Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice value gem in napa”
Reviews.Author: Pstiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in napa. It is quite a value and comparable in feel to a b&b. Rooms are clean with decent bedding. You can tell the owners have updated but the rooms are bit dated. Just consider the styling quaint and it will be perfect. The breakfast was great and probably worth the stay on that alone. Would stay again next time in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “If You're Looking for Comfort & Charm, This is the Right Place!”
Reviews.Author: TRTW
Reviews.Content: I chose the Best Western Plus Elm House Inn because of its TripAdvisor recommendations. I'm glad I made the right choice - thanks reviewers!!! Upon arrival we were greeted immeditately and the lady at the front desk was so nice in explaining what to do in and around Napa Valley - where to go, what to see/do. She explained to us what the property offers and when breakfast/cookie time was. She even gave us a coupon good for wine tasting around Napa Valley. The room was COMFORTABLE and CHARMING. It goes hand in hand. I actually like the yellow/blue motif. The yellow was not too loud, which I like. It really felt like a Bread & Breakfast and it had a wonderful, but small, garden in between. Internet connection was free (even though there were times it was slow) and all amenties were provided. The hotel's lobby is cozy, with a working fireplace and a little area where you can grab a book to read or play board games - yes, they have board games. Like I said, this hotel is like a Bed & Breakfast. Breakfast included oatmeal, fresh fruit, hard-boiled eggs, pastries, bread, waffles, yogurt, and juice. They made the waffles for you and they brought it to your table. The location was ideal and it's a perfect place to unwind and visit downtown. Would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Cozy and Clean”
Reviews.Author: have$willtravel
Reviews.Content: Looks more like an elegant b and b, than a Best Western! With a comfortable, charming lobby with a nice sitting area, a roaring fireplace and the scent of chocolate chip cookies in the air - they had me at "Hello"! Service was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Bed was comfortable. I felt this place was a great value with free wi-fi, breakfast and afternoon cookies and milk. Plan on driving as there are no eateries within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “An Irish B&B in Napa”
Reviews.Author: rjgeorge
Reviews.Content: Recently, my wife and I had the pleasure of spending a weekend at this delightful property. It reminds us so much of a friendly, cheerful Irish B&B. The room was clean, comfortable and cozy. The fireplace added to the ambiance of a charming guest cottage. The morning breakfast, complete with fresh baked bread and waffles, is served in a bright inviting living room However, what sets this place apart and worthy of a returned visit is the outgoing, knowledgeable staff. Recommendations for sights to see and restaurants to experience were spot on. Everyone we encountered could not do enough for us. When in wine country you can pay more for accommodations but not receive the value of this Irish B&B in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Harry B
Reviews.Content: Me and my gf loved this small hotel. it has a very homey and cozy feel from the moment you enter the hotel. when you enter you'll see a couch facing a fireplace. along with the nice setup in the main floor, they have very nice soft lights. it definitely makes you feel relax the moment you enter the hotel. We were upgrade to a, i believe a king size bed with a fireplace to warm the room up. The room is very clean as well as their linen and bathroom. Basically, they cleaned the room from top to bottom, i think. i have no complaints about the cleanliness at all. The stay comes with free breakfast. I'm not a breakfast kinda guy, but i enjoyed it. they had a good variety of food. they had fruits; oranges, grapefruit and i believe there was some grapes. For breakfast lovers, they serve 3-4 several kinds of cereals. They also had muffins, toast, eggs, coffee and almost everything you need to get your day started. They also have awesome staff. They are very friendly and always helpful. These people are locals, so you can ask them bout the best winery, restaurants and hidden gems of napa valley. i wanna say, i wanna give them bonus points for upgrading our room with no extra fees. The hotel is only few blocks away from downtown napa, which boast many specialty restaurtants that you can only find in napa. Downtown napa is i think a must see when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: KCGator12
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a day in Napa while in the area on a business trip. She booked this hotel and we were both amazing at the hospitality. Cozy hotel, incredible service, and the best banana chocolate chip bread you will ever eat. The homemade chocolate chip cookies at happy hour are also a great bonus. Will stay here again without question!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1010
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. A small cozy hotel where the staff were all so friendly and helpful. They helped us plan our drive around the wineries because we had limited time in Napa. The happy hour of home baked cookies, oh my goodness, so delicious! The breakfast next morning was also very good. All in all, I'm so glad we read the reviews on Tripadvisor and booked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great napa hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBeez
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my mother's birthday in napa last weekend and stayed at the Elm House Inn. The Inn is cozy, with beautiful attention to the gardens and comfortable common areas inside and out. We sat in front of the fire with a bottle of wine and their delicious fresh baked cookies in the afternoon. When they found put that we were celebrating a birthday, they had a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us in the lobby when we got arrived back from dinner. Nice touch! My sister has stayed at the owner's son's Best Western in Guerneville and said it had all the charm and great service that the Elm House had. Don't be put off by it being a Best Western. It is a lovely Napa inn.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal experience”
Reviews.Author: kstutz6
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to California to visit Wine Country and the Best Western Elm House Inn was our favorite place to stay. We were treated with such unique, personal service by Tom and the rest of his staff. Our accommodations were superior. We also stayed in their king-size room that was almost as large as a small apartment. The chocolate chip cookies were a special treat and we had some time to enjoy the hot tub, too. Breakfast was delicious and the staff even personally made waffles for you. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nyan777
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, & I stayed for two nights at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and hospitable and the breakfast & cookies in the afternoon was exactly what most people stated in this review...delicious!!! We stayed in the lower floor close to the breakfast area and we were concerned that there would be too much noise with people eating breakfast in the morning but that was not the case at all. The lobby was quiet at night and the Christmas decorations and fireplace made it a really cozy place to read a book. We also appreciate the coffee, tea, and chocolate available until bed time. I wish all hotels provided this much attention to detail and hospitality. The only thing that would make it better would be if the pillows were a little more firm. Other than that, we were very satisfied with everything and highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience all around”
Reviews.Author: Rev K
Reviews.Content: Our room was a very large (almost like an apartment!) king-sized room with a walk-in closet that included an additional sink, vanity and mirror. Everything was extremely clean. Large flat panel TV with HD. The included breakfast was wonderful--the usual continental fare plus oatmeal with all the toppings, waffles made to order, freshly baked breads and fresh fruit. Everyone we met on the staff was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Tom and Connie, you are the best!”
Reviews.Author: PFirst123
Reviews.Content: Not only we had a good stay during the trip to Napa, Tom and Connie looked after us as if we are their relatives. Breakfast was excellent, with efficient service. During my stay I felt very ill. Tom pointed out the hospital for me, and he even called the doctor to standby for me. And after all these extra service, Tom and Connie refused gratuity or tips! All we can say is "Thank you so much! And we'll be back for sure"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: robinredblue
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this place. Excellent staff, comfortable accommodations, and delicious cookies everyday at 6:00 PM (seriously, they are not to be missed). The location is a bit of a walk from downtown -- but still a pretty easy trek, and great location for getting onto the 29 (to many wineries, Yountville, and more). We'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a lovely B & B”
Reviews.Author: bikeboy3
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this wonderful hotel after reading so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The innkeeper Tom upgraded our room for free after hearing it was my birthday. My wife and I were put in a very large room in the newer building. The room was like a suite with flat screen TV, sitting area, king bed that was soooo comfy and a sink in the walk in closet as well as a sink in the main bathroom. The hotel/inn location is a 5 minute drive right into downtown Napa which is being revitalized and has great shops and restaurants on the waterfront. Plus Napa itself is the start of wine country that you can choose to drive up the 29 or take the Silverado trail. Wineries everywhere on both roads! The 29 takes you through St Helena and all the other towns in the area and the Silverado trail is winding country road. In the morning the inn serves a yummy breakfast with homemade waffles, muffins, cereals etc.. so yummy! In the evening they put out fresh baked cookies at 6pm. You can eat breakfast in the lobby by the fireplace or take it to your room. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and recommended some local restaurants that included The Farm which was expensive but fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, friendly staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kentishmayde
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in Napa, the room was large enough for four of us (teenagers in tow), light and airy. The sitting room and hot tub area were inviting, clean and tidy. Breakfast was wonderful, the owner gave us directions to the waterfront for dinner, just as he described, great value for money, you won't go wrong chosing this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming B&B - don't get turned off by the corporate name!”
Reviews.Author: radiance12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Napa with a large group of friends to enjoy a weekend of exploring vineyards, eating delicious food, and sharing good company and conversation. We were all pleasantly pleased - and to be honest, a bit surprised - at how perfectly charming and lovely the Elm House Inn is. Our entire weekend stay was a delight. We were greeted at check-in by the overwhelming smell of freshly baked chocolate chip cookies, accompanied by a cold container of milk. Breakfast was fantastic, complete with hot belgium waffles and homemade coffee cakes. The staff was attentive, the hot tub was ready whenever we wanted to take a dip, and the rooms were large and comfortable. There was a bit of noise from traffic on the nearby street, but that's to be expected in a busy little town like Napa. Elm House is a quick 10 minute walk to downtown Napa, which was great for our group. We were charmed by the Elm House Inn, and we plan to return on a future visit to the Napa Valley!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: CBWritergirl
Reviews.Content: I'm actually staying here right now and enjoying it very much. My room is large, clean, visually appealing. I could ask for a lighter room, the windows face some pretty dense foliage, but it's not a big deal. The people are kind and helpful, the coffee is GREAT and they make homemade muffins which are to die for. Haven't gone down for the breakfast now but if the other reviews are correct it's something to look forward to. I'll amend my review it it wasn't. Wi-Fi works well, mattress is slightly too hard for my taste but probably better for me. NIce and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing deal!”
Reviews.Author: isacarter
Reviews.Content: Let me just name a few of the amenities at this...Best Western: Homemade cookies & milk Personal service Comfortable Beds Homemade Breakfast - banana chocolate nut bread (yum)! If you want to stay somewhere affordable and cozy, do not look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and comfortable stay - would return”
Reviews.Author: writevivamexico
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and sister for my mother's 60th birthday. I would describe it as a hotel that has a touch of bed and breakfast. So, it's not uncomfortable, which is how I personally feel about B&Bs, but it has that family-owned and cozy touch. The lobby area is small, but includes the area where breakfast is served, as well as a couch/chairs by the fireplace-so cozy! The outside seating/garden is off the lobby, and it's cute and cozy out there as well. There was a large binder full of local restaurants that was helpful in viewing menus and picking a restaurant, as well as games, books, etc. available for entertainment. The rooms (we had two queen beds) are small (it was a little crowded for three of us and our carry-on luggage, there is no seating area), but immacuately clean and well-kept. I think that is the most noteable aspect of this hotel...it's very clean and well-kept and you can tell the family takes pride in their hotel! The room had sinks both inside and outside of the bathroom, which was nice with three of us. Also, our room was right next to where the breakfast was served, and we never noticed the noise (other reviewers have commented on this). The breakfast was great and included cereals, oatmeal with fabulous toppings, fresh fruit, made-to-order waffles, juices, yogurt, and breads/bagels/etc. They also had freshly made pumpkin bread available all day and they make homemade cookies at 6pm (with milk). The location is convenient...right off Hwy 29 and a mile from downtown Napa. We had no problem getting around from the hotel. Plus, it's close/cheap enough to take a cab downtown for dinner if you plan to drink. I would absolutely stay here again, but probably wouldn't put more than two people in a double queen room. I'm not sure what other room sizes are available.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and Breakfast Experience at a Best Western Price!”
Reviews.Author: Goneagain
Reviews.Content: Although we don't live far away, it is always fun to spend time in the Napa Valley! We, however, are often discouraged by the prices. This time Elm House Inn was a find!! As others have said, it is more a B&B than hotel...yet it is large enough to not feel intrusive. We asked for an upstairs room and was given Room 201 at the top of the stairs. A corner room with windows on two sides, it was fresh and airy, bright, cheery and comfortable. All that and a large flat screen TV! The only thing that could have been better were the bathroom amenities...better quality tissues, toilet paper. But considering the rest of the inn, that is a tiny criticism! Cookies (right out of the oven) and milk were served at 6 pm. (a little early we thought but we were glad we had an early dinner and got in on time!) The breakfast, served in the charming sitting room, was attractively arranged and fully supplied. And we were immediately offered home cooked waffles (not self served) served to us with warm syrup! Other offerings were fresh fruit, granola, cereal, yogurt, several kinds of good quality bread and english muffins for toasting...as well as individual loaves of nut bread...and probably more! The tables were set with beautiful red quilted place matts and small vases of miniature fresh red tulips. A big, bright Christmas tree and a collection of German style Santas finished the festive country atmosphere. As you can see, I could go on and on!! There is also a "secret garden" type patio and a hot tub!! Service was friendly and we look forward to visiting Room 201 again!! (Try Allegria for dinner...another treat!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent more like a good hotel than a b&b”
Reviews.Author: unckebuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed one nite after the wine train lunch. Nice property adn excellent room. We were in the South building hence no elevator but only one flight up. Very large room with big screen and seperate sinks and toilet/tub.. A nice morning feature. Rooms very clean and pleasant staff. Would stay again if in the area

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: I_love_Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: I won't write much, because all the glowing reviews are already here. We picked the BW Elm House Inn because of the great TripAdvisor reviews, and we were really "wowed" - spectacular breakfast, lovely rooms, great hot tub, very welcoming staff, excellent location, great price. The only tip I'll offer is to call the hotel directly and request a 2nd floor room. This advice was given to me by the staff for our next visit. We checked in late, and the hotel was full, so we had a 1st floor room adjacent to a parking lot. We could have changed for our 2nd night, but even this sub-optimal room was still great (quiet, pretty, and steps from breakfast). So, we didn't bother changing rooms. My husband said we shouldn't even mention the less-than-ideal room, because it was still so great, but I am just writing here since next time we know the key -- call the hotel directly (not central reservations) and just request 2nd floor. That's the only thing we'll do differently next time around!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!!!! Clean, friendly, warm and inviting.”
Reviews.Author: kdanielson2011
Reviews.Content: Took a recent trip to Napa and found this hotel (more like a large bed and breakfast) on Trip Advisor. It was a great find!!! Inexpensive, clean friendly, warm/inviting atmosphere and the breakfasts are AMAZING! The family that runs the hotel really go the extra mile to ensure your stay is beyond your expectations. I was surprised it was a Best Western because it is first class in my opinion. We were truly treated like royalty by these people while in Napa! I really fell in love with this place and these people. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!! Even with a dentist thrown in.”
Reviews.Author: Boerozzie
Reviews.Content: We have travelled all over the world and this is one of the best and cleanest places we have ever stayed at. The breakfast is ample and the people working at the hotel have been amazing and go the extra mile and with a smile. If you visit the Napa this is the place!!! The ladies in the kitchen took my little girl into the kitchen and she made her own waffle. Big smiles all round. I had a mishap with a broken tooth and Tom the manager at the hotel had a dentist organised and had the tooth fixed the next morning. Dr Bradley Jones, at Trancas Street is not far away and if a dentist is required I can recommend him without reservation. He has saved my holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Found through Trip Advisor.”
Reviews.Author: The1Key
Reviews.Content: We check Trip Advisor almost always before making a reservation. The reviewer for this hotel was "spot on." Clean, spacious rooms, uber friendly staff. More of an inn than hotel or motel. Main building has maybe 20 rooms that have access from the main first floor living room, or from the second floor balcony. Following TA's advice we booked room 402 which is in a small, secondary building. Huge room, very clean. Actual downtown Napa is probably a 20 min. walk so that could be a drawback if you want a downtown experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mradicsh
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed here 4 times and have always had a great experience. Very reasonably priced and they give you free breakfast. Breakfast is continental style but they make fresh waffles every day. Highly recommend this hotel if you need a nice room with breakfast and easy access to the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kate0110
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for two nights with a group of friends and we all loved it. The location is great; it's only about a mile from downtown Napa. You could probably walk if the weather is nice. The customer service was excellent. The front desk people were super friendly and offered us some good suggestions on restaurants, etc. Loved the warm fresh baked cookies and milk at 6 PM every night! Definitely a highlight of the trip. :) The breakfast is also amazing as well. Fresh fruit, homemade pastries, etc - you can't go wrong! Parking is convenient and easy and the hotel is very quiet at night. We were a little concerned that we would be able to hear other guests (since the lobby is right outside the door and there are only about 25 rooms overall I'd guess) but people really were very respectful and quiet. Overall the place is a great location, has a bed-and-breakfast feel (with a hotel pricetag) and is super cozy. Several nights we hung out on the couch in front of the fireplace. You definitely feel like you are staying in someone's home here. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely romantic inn in Napa and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: tzamora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 days at the Elm House Inn (Nov. 3 and 4, 2011). This inn is so romantic, with a beautiful garden, very cordial and helpful employees, wonderful big cozy clean rooms, very nice continental breakfast, and a great location. It was a very pleasant experience. I had a wonderful time in Napa and when we return, we will head to the Elm House Inn. I will gladly recommend it to my friends and family. We thought it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: dallasiteonbusiness
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best WEstern Elm House Inn in Napa on Nov. 4th weekend. It was a charming and friendly place, very small and cozy. I have to rave about the breakfast spread each morning that is complimentary. It was absolutely delicious, healthy, fresh and a great variety. The staff even makes custom waffles and serves, it's like dining in a little cozy cafe. The hotel itself was clean, beds comfy, all amenities were fine, it's not upscale but it's just easy and has what you need. They also serve complimentary fresh baked chocolate chip cookies at 6pm each day, yum! It was a nice place to stay, not particularly within walking distance to any restaurants or the downtown shops, but within 2 miles at the most!

Reviews.Title: “I think some fairies run this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marlenemosh
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Napa or anywhere around the wine region you need to stay in this hotel. It's amazing! After a whole day of wine tasting, eating, walking, picture taking and driving, the only thing you want is to get to your hotel not only to be welcomed by a lovely person but with an amazing cookie (secret recipe), milk, coffee or tea and a huge smile! I read all the reviews done for this place and well they all were right, the place is lovely. You feel like a guest in someones house. The garden in the back is so lovely I just went to the gazebo to sit and contemplate. But the most important thing is the amazing staff, or as I call them the Best Western Fairies. Always with a smile, always willing to do more than you ask, and there will always be a freshly baked waffle at your breakfast table. Thank you all for those amazing two days! This Best Western ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: scarlettmorgan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Elm House toward the end of October 2011. Tom, Connie and their excellent staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. Excellent breakfast items, particularly the fresh baked muffins and real Belgian waffles. On one evening, my wife and I had a little picnic in front of the fireplace with a fine bottle of wine we had purchased at a tasting and food items (cheeses, pate) purchased at the Sunshine market in St Helena. Located near downtown Napa, HWY 29 and the Silverado Trail. We will definintely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: j_r_j_2626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Best Western Elm House in Napa for one night. We wish we could have stayed much, much longer! The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the room was surprisingly large and very comfortable, the atmosphere was great, and the breakfast was delicious! We will definitely be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “WARM COOKIES AND MILK PLUS OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: aerobicpt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived for check in just as warm chocolate cookies were being. Immediately upon arrival we were greeted with smiles and genuiness kindness and concern to make our stay excellent. To say it was excellent would not describe our experience. Tom Kearns and his wife, inn keepers extraordinare, were fabulous and so accommodating. Tom was there in the evening making cookies and in the morning making fresh muffins and belgian waffles! Our room in the cottage house was huge and very comfortable. We have traveled extensively. We have never stayed at a Best Western, but if others are anything close to the experience here, we will look for them when we travel. It is close to downtown and to the wineries. Parking is free! And the customer service truly is outstanding. If you are going to Napa, see if you are lucky enough to stay in this inn. You will not regret it. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “What wonderful and quaint place”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler-kidz
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. Our room was very spacious. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not your basic Best Western”
Reviews.Author: CarmelTraveler39
Reviews.Content: Outstanding!!! Innkeepers Tom and Connie are the BEST hosts. The room was fantastic. The atmosphere was superb. The breakfast was fresh and very good. We thought we might have to change rooms as we added a day late. We told Tom and Connie that we'd like to stay in the same room and through a cancellation, a bit of shuffling on their part, we arrived back at the hotel after a balloon ride to a note that said we wouldn't have to move. Great customer service!! They knew our name and treated their guests as if they were staying at their home. Thanks! We are DEFINITELY return customers.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Best Western Elm House”
Reviews.Author: RoMiItaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House last week for four nights and loved it. The inn, overall, was very welcoming, starting with the beautiful landscaped entrance to those that greeted us at the front desk. Our room was spacious and well appointed, had a fireplace and fridge, and the bathroom was immaculately clean – a very important thing when travelling. Every evening they put out delicious freshly-baked chocolate chip cookies, and milk. The breakfast spread was terrific. They would make made-to-order Belgian waffles, fresh coffee breads and also had fruit salad, cereals, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, and an array of juices and coffees. The inn keepers were always pleasant and helpful. Every morning, we would have our breakfast out by the terrace enjoying the lush foliage. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HOTEL011
Reviews.Content: Hi. We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel in late Sept. The owners of the hotel were very helpful and went out of your way to help you with anything you needed. I bought some wine and was shipping it home, so they helped me out with providing me information on where to ship from and even provided me with packing tape. The hotel itself only has about 23 rooms and is more like a bed and breakfast. There is parking on both sides of the hotel. The hotel is located at a busy intersection, but the hotel itself is very quite. The breakfast is amazing and the staff really goes out of your way to make sure everything is well stocked.The breakfast had different muffins everyday, waffles to order, etc. This was alot different from your normal "Best Western" hotel. The staff, location, breakfast really make this hotel stand out. Also, every night they made fresh chocolate chip cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for touring wineries”
Reviews.Author: Wil-Jam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. We had booked and prepaid a bigger room with the fire place, but I guess that they don't have one for wheelchair users and we got an ADA room. The room was clean and suited our needs, it was nothing special. The breakfast was good, although we would have liked to have some more salty options because most of the breakfast was sweet. The staff was really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously great service, location, value and rooms - and cookies!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic find - thanks so much for all the other great reviews on this site as otherwise I would have never thought to book the Elm House. Ignore the fact it is a BW - this feels more like a family-run B&B than a chain hotel. It is on the road on the way into Napa town centre, so downtown in walkable in 20ish minutes but its easy to get out to the wineries. When we arrived, reception were chatty and welcoming, and told us about the 6pm cookies and milk. We really needed some dinner, so they gave us some walkable options that didn't take bookings (went to one, the Bounty Hunter, which was fantastic - great advice!) and said they would keep our cookies for us. And, as they said, we found them in our room under a pretty glass holder when we got back - and they were even more delicious than expected (tip: the next night we were around to get them at 6pm, and they were even better warm - make sure you're in)! Our room was out the back of the main building, on the ground floor of a sweet-looking house by the hot tub (a nice addition - we were the only people in it when we took a dip at 8.30pm). It was huge, quiet, had a great (enormous) bed, bath and massive shower - and seperate toilet. There was even a walk-in dressing room with mirror and spare sink. Breakfast also exceeded our expectations - it was in the open area behind reception, and as well as bagels, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, etc, they offer you huge homemade waffles to order. Get one if you have an appetite! Sadly, we probably won't be back in Napa soon, being from the UK, but I will certainly be telling all my friends and family to go if they are ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “'Inn'credible Elm House-pitality”
Reviews.Author: bizzylizzy158
Reviews.Content: Along with many other folk, we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor, and I'm happy to say I agree with all the positive comments that have gone before and we weren't disappointed. Although a Best Western Hotel, the more impersonal elements of a chain hotel are not in evidence here. Elm House Inn was clean, bright and cheery. The staff were, without exception, helpful and absolutely charming. We stayed in two different rooms during our visit, both were a little bit pink for my taste, but both were comfortable and clean. Each room had a mini fridge, which is obviously handy during hot spells. We had an ipad with us and used the free WiFi signal with no problems. I would mention, the aircon was a wee bit noisy. Unlike other reviewers we heard no real street noise (except for a motorbike that seemed to go past at the same time every morning whilst we were there) but nobody can really crib at people going off to work for the day. There's a small garden which is very pretty and well tended. A baby squirrel put in an appearance when we were there and caused much hilarity and eeks from some quarters. There was a hot tub in the garden which we didn't use ourselves. The hotel provides a washing machine and dryer for use by the guests. You'll need four quarters for each. You can buy washing powder from reception for a dollar. The delicious Breakfasts made a great start to the day. Everything from bowls of Fruit to Muffins, Bagels and fantastic Waffles with Maple Syrup. We were to sample breakfasts at another Best Western in Carmel a few days later and there couldn't have been a starker difference between the two hotels. But where this hotel really scores top marks is the with it's owners and their staff. Having worked in the hospitality industry myself I know that some guests can be harder work than others and it can sometimes be tricky to keep smiling. But the team at this hotel do exactly that. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble and every member of staff seemed genuinely happy in their work. Father, daughter and staff should be proud of themselves for the level of service they offer at the Elm House Inn. They might consider running a few masterclasses for a few other hoteliers I can think of!! As for Napa itself. Oddly enough we found little to do in Napa. It takes about fifteen to twenty minutes easy walking to get to the centre. We did find the wines far far more expensive than in the UK. The weather was hot, so we actually drank more juice and the odd bottle of beer whilst we were there. If you're on a budget, try Sabor Bistro for supper. It's South American street food. They don't take reservations and you can see why, it was bustling when we went there. You can order a few dishes off the menu and and they will provide you with tasting plates so that you can share. As far as we could see, loads of locals were filling up the tables - and that's always a good recommendation. It's worth investigating the Uptown Theatre in Napa, they do seem to get a really decent variety of performers there. We were miffed to have missed Emmylou Harris who appeared there whilst we were in Napa. We only found out afterwards. Trips out. We visited Calistoga, further up the valley. It seems like a super little town, the locals are lovely and there are some nice shops. There's a super duper clothes shop for we ladies. If you like slightly more unusual clothes that stand out from the crowd (think sixties with a pinch of hippy, and a dash of Glastonbury) then go to Zenobia. Lisa the owner is absolutely charming. We felt like good friends by the time we left the shop. I bought a hat and wished I'd had more money and more room in my suitcase to buy loads of her lovely clothes. Try and visit the Yo El Rey organic coffee shop run by another lovely friendly Calistoga resident. Each cup is lovingly made. It takes a bit of time, but it's worth the wait. If you're of an arty persuasion try http://www.dirosapreserve.org/ We enjoyed one of their regular tours. What an amazing place. You get to visit the galleries and a house crammed full of 2000 pieces by more than 800 artists. The charming and knowledgeable volunteer guides show people around the galleries and then take you up to the main house in a Jinty (a little trailer with seats towed by a four wheel drive). They really look after disabled visitors by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Napa”
Reviews.Author: moneret
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for one night at the end of September. It is a bed and breakfast style hotel a 30 minute walk from downtown Napa. The things that stood out were the owners' pride in the property, the good value for its Napa location, and the great breakfast. We found the decor to be a little tired and dated, but this is personal taste. We appreciated the free parking, free wifi and breakfast. Many thanks for making Napa more affordable! Restaurant tip: we had a fabulous meal at Celadon in downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: TravelCat_MA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on a recent visit to Napa. It feels more like a B&B than a hotel when you're inside. Our 3rd floor room was clean and quiet and even had a fireplace. The "extras" included with our stay were great: mini-fridge in the room, guest laundry, hot tub, breakfast, and of course the fresh baked cookies every evening. The common room has complimentary coffee, tea, and water, along with board games, books, and 1/2 price wine tasting coupons for numerous wineries in the area. The staff was very nice and even made dinner reservations for us. And the location is perfect: right off of 29 and just down the street from downtown Napa. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: The Elm House Inn is a wonderful and cozy Inn. It’s a hybrid between a hotel and B&B. The employees were friendly and offer great suggestions ranging from dining locations to wine tours. My wife and I had one of the best dinners of our trip based on their recommendation. Room was clean, bright and comfortable. Can’t say enough about this place and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: kpit70
Reviews.Content: Tom and Connie treated us very well. From the fresh waffles in the morning to the fresh baked cookies in the evening. The location was very convenient to both sanoma and Napa wineries. The staff was very attentive without being overbearing. Kelly was a sweetheart and if you stay here you must meet ZuZu!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Find”
Reviews.Author: grum69_11
Reviews.Content: We had pre-booked this hotel to bridge the gap between the Californian coast and Lake Tahoe, which we were to visit for the next week. The hotel is conveniently located just off Highway 29, although it is a ten mimute drive into the centre of Napa. On arrival, we were greeted and shown our room, which was on the second floor. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a pleasant decor. Breakfast was included - mainly a cold buffet but with the choice of a couple of hot options (e.g. waffles). We would rate the hotel as better than many of its type.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose the Elm House to celebrate our anniversary. We were a little apprehesive about selecting the place, since we wanted a b & b experience. Our stay was terrific, well above our expertations. The hospitality of the inn keepers and their staff was great, very clean and had all the charm of a top knotch bed anind breakfast. Especially liked the fresh baked goods served at breakfast and 6:00 cookie time every day. The was also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: We had plenty of hotels from which to choose at this price point in Napa, and tried the Elm House Inn partly based on reviews here and its size. We were not disappointed, and in fact pleasantly surprised at how comfortable and welcoming everyone on staff was from the first hello -- not the placating greeting all in hospitality are trained to do. Tom and Connie, your Innkeepers, are genuinely concerned with your comfort as are their staff. We are definitely booking with them again based on our first visit there. We were also there during the power outage (Peter C's review) where Tom and Connie had everything ready for guests' return that evening. They are just as amazing under pressure!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Jennie1975
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews on Trip Advisor but this hotel was so fantastic I want to share my great experience with everyone. This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The service was exceptional, the hotel was clean and beatifully kept, and the location is perfect. The fresh flowers in your room, homemade cookies at 6:00pm and home cooked breakfast give this hotel the feeling of a B&B but better. We stayed two nights and on our last night there was a power outage that lasted over 10 hours. The staff provided candles and lanterns to everyone and when we checked out we found out they were not charging anyone in the hotel for that night. Even if they had charged us for that night I would still be writing this glowing review because I haven't seen service like this before in any hotel that I've stayed in. Next time i'm in Napa I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We've already booked for another stay!”
Reviews.Author: olivia64
Reviews.Content: I can't compare this inn with other accommodations in Napa, but we hit the jackpot on this place. Clean, quiet, great breakfast, outdoor hot tub, walking distance to downtown Napa and a very helpful staff. Like my title of review says, we've already booked again for next month. Thanks Tom, we found a new home in Napa. See you guys soon!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend. Unfortunately an incompetent tree firm managed to down the power lines that fed the hotel, and, for that matter a large section of the town of Napa. The hotel provided flashlights and kept everyone informed, which was as much as could be done in the circumstances. But on check-out, we were told that the night without power would not be charged! In my opinion, this was far beyond what they were obliged to do, since the power cut was totally beyond their control. Oh, and the hotel was well up to expectations based on other reviews. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best "Best Western" on our trip!”
Reviews.Author: peter41
Reviews.Content: On our 3 week long trip through Nordern California we stayed a the Elm House Inn and can only confirm all the positiv reviews on tripadvisor. This hotel is like a "De Luxe" B & B - but for a decent price! Nobody beats the friendliness of the owners and the staff - from the warm welcome to the breakfast service next morning. By the way we enjoyed here the best breakfast of several BW hotels. The staff asked us serval times if they could prepare something special - but the buffet was really good enough. We had a quiet room on the 3rd floor, very clean. Elm House Inn has an elevator, free computer and a fireplace in the cozy lobby. If you stay in Napa - make your reservation at the Elm House Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Globalphile
Reviews.Content: Unlike what you would expect at a Best Western this was just like staying in a small inn or B&B. It was well located, had all the amenities including free wifi and a great fresh breakfast with fruit, muffins, oatmeal etc. The staff was excellent and most accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOSPITALITY AT ELM HOUSE INN”
Reviews.Author: farandaway54
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Elm House Inn in Napa and enjoyed our time there very much. As mentioned many times before this is really a Bed & Breakfast Inn. The staff could not have been nicer. The ambiance was cozy; breakfasts wonderful; rooms nice sized and very clean. The value for the cost can't be beat! We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit Napa. Thank you Tom and staff for a great stay ... next time we will remember to have those afternoon cookie treats put aside for later!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: RGK115
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I could not have had a more pleasant stay. Tom was super accommodating upon our arrival and checked in with us throughout our trip to make sure everything was going smoothly. He even came to our aid when our wine tour had a reservations snafu in that they did NOT make any arrangements for us. (note: Shaw's Transportation was NOT a good choice, don't book with them). Tom called wineries to help us salvage the day. They really just went above and beyond at the Elm House Inn. Comfy rooms, wonderful breakfast, clean and quaint. Exactly what we wanted for our first trip to the Napa Valley. Ask about the coupon box -- we saved a lot with 2-for-1 tastings!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously good!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny368
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon. Before we got to the room the staff were organising our wine trips and advising us. we did nothing they did it all. They even booked the restaurant that we wanted to go to for us. The room we got was amazing. Huge room huge bed and comfortable. The breakfasts are awesome. Have the waffles. To top it all of you get cookies and milk at 6 in the evening. All I can say is.... Be in at 6. The cookies are to die for and they are warm. One of the best hotels I have had the pleasure of staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely inn”
Reviews.Author: toronto4
Reviews.Content: A colleague had stayed at this Inn last summer and recommended it to me. We found the bedroom and breakfast area to be well decorated and well maintained. The staff were pleasant and eager to make one's visit enjoyable. We walked downtown for dinner and admired the architecture of some of the stately homes along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffdeelux
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better place to stage your Napa Valley experience. And you couldn't ask for a better atmosphere to experience Napa. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast delicious, the rooms are comfortable and the price is just right.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiloverChicago
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price for Napa. We had a signature room in the building in the back. Large room with jacuzzi tub and separate shower. Also had second sink in closet area with frig. Breakfast was good it was nice to have them make the waffles and toast and not having to do it yourself - like the Best Western in Half Moon Bay. The owner was there at breakfast and check-in and check-out and was so friendly and helpful. Gave us good suggestions and directions when needed. Loved everything about the place. About a mile from downtown and near Hwy 29.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: MPKJ
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Elm House Inn and it was as advertised! Don't let the Best Western name scare you off, this is an adorable B&B. Staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. It is at the southern end of the valley so you will be traveling 15-30 minutes to other areas and there is little you can walk to. But if you are looking for a cute place to lay your head at night, this hotel is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the heart of Napa”
Reviews.Author: yblain
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for money. I was weary when I checked in, as the hotel is really downtown and near the 29 freeway. But we got a room on the second floor of the building behind the hotel, which was remarkably quiet. Large room, FANTASTIC service and great breakfast. All that at a price you can't beat anywhere else in the region. I will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to details”
Reviews.Author: mphgsp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Napa and stayed here. They certainly pay attention to all of the little details and it shows. Wonderful room, delicious breakfast, and chocolate chip cookies were amazing. Could not have picked a more perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “It was like staying with great friends!”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne B
Reviews.Content: Tom & Connie; and daughter Kelly run this like a bed & breakfast. They go above and beyond with smiles; and grab opportunities to be helpful. They truly cared about what we were doing; and if we were fully enjoying Napa. Breakfast is home cooked food. It was quiet and relaxing; with a waterfall patio soothing the morning. Room was fully confortable and adequate with fireplace, tub/shower; refrigerator, night light, bath matt, flat screen, comfy firm bed, and 2 bathroom sink work stations. Just loved it! Did I mention the milk and home-made chocolate chip cookies??? Great place! Also...good location to taxicab it to Napa Wine Train....so you can keep drinking and leave the driving to others! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Top notch and friendly”
Reviews.Author: 1Rooster
Reviews.Content: As with many others I booked here based on the glowing TA reviews. It was our first night in California at the start of a five week holiday. The Elm House is easy to find and while not really within walking distance to the centre of Napa it is a quick drive. It is a wonderful place to stay. We had room number 4 upstairs in the "annex" and it was very large, comfortable, beautifully furnished and it suited all our needs. I was unwell and didn't want to have the aircon on so opened a couple of the windows as it was a pretty warm night. This unfortunately exposed the Elm House's proximity to the freeway and some of the local street noises. So if you're a light sleeper or like to have the windows open, this could be an issue. But really, this is a beautiful property with friendly helpful staff, operated and decorated as a B&B rather than a BW Motel with nicely landscaped grounds. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME with cottage-like feel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RNgypsy
Reviews.Content: We will definately stay here again. When we checked in yesterday the smell of freshly baked cookies just blew us away & there was milk as well. A very home-like atmosphere within a nice walking distance from Historic Downtown Napa. The staff there was absolutely THE BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: TonyBHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: Without doubt one of the nicest B & B's I've ever stayed in. Lovely room and public areas...friendly staff and a great inclusive buffet breakfast. I've usually avoided Best Westerns, but this Best Western 'Plus' was a real find. It is about a 10 minute drive to the 'Main Street' restaurants so a car is a necessity. Would very happily stay here again if I visit the Nappa Valley again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: faeanna
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best bargain hotels I've ever visited, in Napa or otherwise. It truly is a bed and breakfast at a hotel price. The breakfasts are made to order plus a large continental assortment. The rooms are large and well appointed. The jacuzzi out back is in a pretty garden setting. The location was quite convenient to downtown Napa plus near the highway to Sonoma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, all the reviews are on point.”
Reviews.Author: Lou-Moni
Reviews.Content: A wondeful B&B in Napa with spacious rooms, excellent customer service and great location. We had a second level room in the 4th building that stayed quiet and comfortable the entire time. Highly recommed.....and do not forget about the warm delicious cookies made at 6pm everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: BJMM_4
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the BW Elm House Inn during a family vacation to California. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was SO friendly and gave us plenty of great recommendations for places to eat and wineries to visit. The breakfast was delicious with a lot of choices and even home made waffles (my daughter's favorite). And the afternoon cookies were to die for (my favorite)!! Definately will stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service & value...”
Reviews.Author: djm0810
