Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Napa Valley for a week...chose this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor...it certainly met and exceeded our expectations. Tom was the perfect host and it mattered so much as my husband became ill and we needed the TLC provided by our host....I can guarantee you will not find that in any other hotel (especially not a chain hotel.) The room was spacious, sparkling clean with no detail overlooked. The hot tub though small was perfect after a busy day at the wineries. Breakfast was delicious and a few mornings were cool enough for a lovely fire in the breakfast/living room. Everyone there could not have been more helpful, kind & considerate. We hope to return soon and Elm House Inn will be the first call we make.

Reviews.Title: “B&B Feel without the High Price!”
Reviews.Author: travelguyky
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry it's taken me a month to brag on this place. My wife and I had a fantastic week here in mid -July. Spacious room. A lavish breakfast to set you up for the day. Homemade waffles to die for! The jacuzzi in the courtyard is big enough for eight and perfectly maintained! If you'll be out at 6PM don't worry about missing the greatest fresh baked chocolate chip cookies you've ever eaten. They'll stash some for you till you get back later in the evening! The only thing I can possibly come up with that could be a negative is that the mattress in our bed was firm but not super firm. And that is reaching... I had to think for 10 minutes before coming up with that. The hotel location was also a plus. Very easy to get to the highway, yet we never heard traffic from our room overlooking the courtyard. I actually get "homesick thinking about how I miss the place! Our rate was low compared to other places in the area. The local ownership is intimately involved in the day-to-day workings of the place so you know the staff is always bringing their "A" game. I travel for work and stay at many hotels...If I could only keep coming back here! :-)

Reviews.Title: “I really dont see what all the fuss is about w this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SboomFW
Reviews.Content: my bf and i traveled to sonoma/napa for vacation in june.. i read all reviews on trip advisor before i book anywhere, and everyone raved about this hotel so much that i HAD to book a couple of nights here. we stayed a couple of nights in the best western in sonoma first, and really, i wish we would have just stayed there instead of moving over to elm house. the bw in sonoma is MUCH nicer, witha better location, and even cheaper. this hotel wasn't nasty or anything.. it just wasn't worth the $ to stay in someones living room, basicly. we had absolutely NO privacy the 1st night. the 2nd night we were in the other building (i highly recommend you stay in the other building, or not at all).. the 1st night, our room was basicly in the lobby. we heard every person come in, and out, and of course were woken up bright and early by people eating breakfast and checking out. seriously.. you are like not even 10 feet from the front desk workers. i felt like we needed to wisper and keep the tv down extremely low so that we didnt disturb anyone else. to me, it was uncomfortable to not really have any privacy whatsoever. the beds were really small inside too. the staff was nice, and the cookies were delish, but when we go back to napa, we will stay somewhere else for sure. somewhere where it doesn't seem like the front desk can hear every little thing we say and do. even tho they are nice, it's still very akward to be literally 10 ft from the workers there, when you are trying to have some r&r. and if you want romance/intimacy.. forget about it. unless you are okay with everyone hearing everything. also.. no pool here. just a hottub, and it was out of commission when we were staying there. bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch lodging/best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: cadunkin
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, wonderful breakfasts, homemade cookies every evening in the lobby. So many small touches here that make a place memorable. We won't stay anywhere else in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a personal touch!!”
Reviews.Author: Comesanas
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there for only one night but, so glad we did. I booked it based upon previous reviews and I am happy to pass it along. The hotel is small and very quaint almost felt like home. The owners/management staff is very friendly and helpful, the room size is just right equipped with a refrig and coffee maker. The hotel lobby, breakfast area is cozy/comfortable with a fire place and candles lite in the evening. The hotel serves a ry fresh and amazing extended continental breakfast that includes fresh fruit, cereals, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, assorted pastries, waffles with numerous toppings, coffee, juices and milk. In the late afternoon, they served the most delicious cookies and milk. I highly recommend this hotel and if I ever returned to Napa, we will most definitely stay at Best Western Elm House Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little gem in Napa”
Reviews.Author: SSLtravel
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here on our recent trip to California wine country. We come from an area of the country in which Best Westerns do not have the best reputation, so I was a bit wary of making a reservation at this hotel. However, reviews were positive online and prices were reasonable, so we gave it a try. We were so glad we did!! This place is a really adorable gem in Napa. So quaint - more like a bed and breakfast. Innkeeper was so friendly and super helpful with meal suggestions and anything else we needed during our stay. Hotel is in great location - not in downtown Napa, but very close. Delicious breakfast included in stay, as well as fresh baked cookies and milk at 6 everyday. We were off on wine tours so didn't spend too much time at the hotel during the day to know whether it was quiet or it had activities for guests, but our room was huge and quite clean. We were in the apartment house out back, which appeared to only have stairs up to the second floor - just something to think about if you need elevator access - perhaps the main building has one. Had a nice, quiet night sleep and really enjoyed our time here. Would definitely stay here again and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: VikiB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a gentle mile walk from the city centre in a quiet suburb close to the main road, so easy to find. Very much a couples hotel, children and families did look a little out of place. Lovely big room, very clean with good quality linens, decor was like a nice family home. Service was prompt and friendly. They had really thought about their customers and ensured we wanted for nothing. Ice on every floor, bottle openers at reception, restaurant menus, the wonderful cookies and milk at 6pm. The breakfast was beautiful, freshly made to order light fluffy waffles, fresh fruit and oatmeal with a range of toppings. There is a hot tub but very few other facilities, but this is still a great place to lay your head whilst you tour Napa and Sonoma.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and wish our stay had been longer!”
Reviews.Author: Puertorricantraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two little girls (ages 6 and 8), and I stayed at the Best Western Elm House Inn during July 18-21; it was an amazing experience. We arrived in the evening and were warmly welcomed by Christina, who made the check-in process really pleasant and fast. Upon our arrival we had been greeted by the aroma of freshly-baked chocolate chip cookies; Christina herself brought cookies along with four glasses of milk to our room (it was a really nice gesture). Our stay couldn't have been better. Our room was really nice and comfortable (as was the rest of the property), the breakfast was great (the cook-to-order Belgian waffles were the best I've ever had in my life), the courtyard is beautiful, but, the best thing about this hotel is its staff: Christina and Berta (front-desk), and Miriam and Emma (who were in charge of breakfast) went out of their way to make us feel at home (which was really nice since we were a long way from ours: Puerto Rico). The owners, Tom and Connie, were frequently around checking on the guests and making sure that everybody was well-tended (which we were). We couldn't be more grateful to the staff of the Em House Inn for such a wonderful stay; whenever we go back to Napa Valley we'll surely stay there again. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Cozy, great location!”
Reviews.Author: az_travellr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The Inn is not set amongst the rolling vineyards but it is in a quiet setting conveniently located to highways that take you to the Napa wineries. Downtown is 5 min away by car. Our room was spacious, cheerfully decorated and very clean. Toiletries were provided as well as extra towels, robes, a bar fridge and free high speed internet. A complimentary breakfast was included and was fabulous!.. coffee, juice, fresh fruit, breads, Belgian waffles made to order , freshly baked mini banana loaves, yogurt... I could go on and on. Breakfast could be enjoyed in the lobby or on the adjoining outdoor patio. The fresh flowers on the tables were a nice touch. Around 6pm each day, fresh baked cookies and milk were offered... delicious! There are laundry facilities available, and an outdoor hot tub located in a cozy garden setting. And I can't forget to mention the staff! ...all of them went out of their way to make us feel at home from greeting us at breakfast by name to answering our numerous questions about sights to see and places to eat. We would highly recommend the Elm House Inn to anyone visiting Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: 225Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Elm House Inn for 3 nights in early June. We had 2 rooms in the main building and very much enjoyed our stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and they have a way of making guests feel welcome. The weather was rather rainy and cool while we were there, and in the evening it was very nice to return to the hotel, where they had a warm fire burning in the lobby fireplace. Unlike larger, more impersonal hotels, we felt quite comfortable sitting by the fire and enjoying conversation. While not luxurious or elegantly decorated, our rooms were very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was very good - several notches better than the typical hotel breakfast. Most mornings it included a very nice selection of fresh fruit, yogurt and a variety of fresh baked breads. Waffles are made to order. We also enjoyed the cookies every afternoon. As some have mentioned, the hotel is not located in the downtown area, but it is a very short drive if you want to shop or have dinner at one of the restaurants in that area. We actually spent very little time in downtown Napa, so that wasn't a problem for us. Most of the places we wanted to visit were in areas north of Napa itself. I plan to return to the area soon and will almost certainly stay at Elm House Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Average accomodations with above-average hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SeasideSeeker
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for three nights during a busy summer weekend. Upon entering, we were warmly greeted with fresh-from-the-oven cookies (fortuitous timing), a clean room, and a receptionist brimming with helpful advice. The location is great if you want to stay in the town of Napa: seeing as it is literally 0.2 miles from the highway exit, one can quickly start their Valley adventures hopping on and off the highway ramps. However, it is about seven blocks from downtown Napa. Overall, the exterior of the building is quite charming. The inside is a little off-not tacky or refined, just...fine. The rooms were comfortable, clean, and big enough, with wifi and flat-screens and excellent air conditioning. Again, not remarkable decor, but not ugly, either. Just...fine. My one caveat is to install an outlet at the "vanity"mirror outside the bathroom. Whenever one of us was showering or using the toilet, the other could not plug anything in. Breakfast was delightful; hard-boiled eggs, cereal, oatmeal, fresh waffles, fruit, coffee, orange juice, etc. This and their "happy hour" cookies was easily my favorite aspect. The people running the inn are remarkable: this is the inn's real jewel-they are friendly, helpful, remember you and any questions you may have had, and we encountered not a single problem during our stay. Overall, esp. considering the price, I would stay here again if I wanted to have my start/end point be Napa. The locale is excellent and breakfast is marvelous. I think in the future, however, I may choose to stake out Yountville or further, since many of the more desirable wineries tend to be down the road. Again, that's my opinion, and you may entirely disagree with me! I would, however, miss those cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: sandieog
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Napa for the first time, and we were so pleased with the gracious hotel staff and lovely hotel room. The front desk staff were very welcoming and very helpful in planning our wine tour. Also, the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, quant small hotel with very personal service.”
Reviews.Author: Judyannnick
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying our stay at this Best Western with a bed and breakfast feel. The staff could not be more helpful and attentive. I would definately put this on my list of favorites. We will remember our stay here fir a long time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Drarig
Reviews.Content: The Elm House will definitely meet your expectations. Location may not be ideal but it is convenient, close to the Highway and minutes away from downtown Napa, but do not expect scenic views! Service at the Elm House is very professional and courteous, the breakfast is one of the best you can find in any Best Western and the rooms are immaculate. The staff will be pleased to suggest restaurants in Napa or visits in the area. Will surely visit this Best Western at my next visit in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jewney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week after hearing about staying here from many other people. The countless excellent reviews could not be more true! The room was clean, cozy and comfy! The robes were wonderful, especially perfect for going into and out of the hot tub! One of the best things was waking up to the smell of fresh made belgian waffles and warm banana chocolate muffins! Absolutely delicious. Not to mention the fresh baked cookies the night before! Everything about this hotel has a special touch and it is obvious and evident that the owners take pride in doing so! And the staff is extremely welcoming and accommodating. I can't wait to get back to Napa and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: AnaikWM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed for a night while visiting the wineries in Napa and this hotel was a great surprise! The ambience is comfortable, the room was amazing and the staff so nice. We felt at home! the room we got had this huge bed, great amenities and all that you need for a nice romantic evening. We would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Just as the previous reviewers have said - this place is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: lisathew8lifter
Reviews.Content: While this wasn't our first trip to Napa, it was our first stay IN Napa. This place was recommended to us from a friend who found it through Trip Advisor. It is exactly what people have described: clean, comfortable, hospitable, and the breakfast is wonderful! Our room had a king bed, coffee maker, fireplace and refridgerator. We obv didn't use the fireplace, and weren't in it long enough to use the coffee maker or refridgerator since we were so busy! The breakfast had all you could want or need in the morning and the people are constantly refilling, taking your dishes away and are available for anything you could possibly need. I regret that i didn't tip the two mornings we were there. The first day we only had large bills, the second day we totally forgot. So, if you are there, keep that in mind because they provide awesome service for a FREE breakfast that is top notch! If we do Napa again, we'd definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and inviting, the opposite of impersonal hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Gregght
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on 3 different occasions and each time my view of the Elm House Inn is reinforced. Tom is a great host and nothing is a problem, he will always try and help. The Inn has an intimate feel and is the opposite of a large hotel where you are just another customer, at the Inn you are made to feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Best Western experience”
Reviews.Author: MELCOR
Reviews.Content: Didn't wana leave & woulda stay longer if they had room. Was a great stay & will definitely be staying there next time in Napa. All the reviews are true. Owner & staff are wonderful & I'd go back just for the warm homemade cookies! Great location & just an overall exceptional hotel experience. If they can get you in I highly recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; clean, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: maryChico
Reviews.Content: Nice location off freeway. Residentail neighborhood, a few miles from riverfront and downtown. Nice check-in staff. Pretty nice for a Best Western; had the feel of a small, family run hotel. Attractive from the outside and clean, very large rooms. Lots of FREE parking available in their own lot and off street. Also, high speed internet is free; what I consider a must these days.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly warm B&B”
Reviews.Author: wwtravelerRochester
Reviews.Content: While this is a Best Western you would never think it was a chain. A friendly warm B&B. The staff is first class. The rooms are comfortable and well laid out. Good continental breakfast. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Napa (B&B-ish) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBing
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Elm House Inn. The hotel was well maintained & the staff was more than welcoming, treating guests like it was a B&B. Except for those future occasions when I'm looking to make Napa reservations (and therefore need the Elm House Inn to have at least one available room), everyone should stay here! We had an excellent stay (and Napa area vacation). We'll definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyBell2007
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about our stay! Excellent rooms, excellent staff, excellent breakfasts. Tom and Bertha were extremely helpful and welcoming. loved our experience at Elm House Inn. Would recommend this to anyone visiting Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint / Lovely and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8Colorado
Reviews.Content: Very cute .. run more like a B&B. Nice beds and rooms kept clean. Owners (?) were extremely nice and helpful... made us fresh waffles to start out our day along with their other breakfast items. Good location and easy to find right off the highway and easy to get into the downtown walking area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Reviews - this is a Great Place to Stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: -The Elm House Inn is a great experience! -Good base to see Napa Valley. -Breakfasts are amazing ... get the waffles (cooked to order)!! -Afternoon chocolate chip cookies and milk are reason enough to stay here!! -Innkeepers Connie and Tom Kearns, and their whole staff, made this a truly memorable stay! They couldn't do enough to be sure everyone had what they needed. From restaurant recommendations to suggestions of which wineries to visit, they made it very easy to enjoy Napa! They even arranged a whole day winery tour ... ask them about Platypus Tours and Kevin Mergardt ... well worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: PandC_11
Reviews.Content: This place combines the best elements of a hotel and a Bed & Breakfast. Hosts are gracious and helpful, the rooms large and comfy and the breakfast was exceptional. It was our favorite hotel of our trip through Russian River/Sonoma/Napa. It's an easy walk into town (20 min) along a nice residential street lined with several Victorian homes. We very much enjoyed walking into town and eating at the Allegria restaraunt - great food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good site with excellant value”
Reviews.Author: raddocmed
Reviews.Content: This was an extremely nice surprise for me. I have stayed in Napa at several other more expensive places. Yes some of them are more romantic and have nice features, but cost 3x as much or more. If you just want a clean, comfortable, and convenient place to stay then this will meet your needs. If you are looking for a resort atmosphere then look elsewhere. The operators here were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, best breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: ltangelo
Reviews.Content: When we were given the room right off the breakfast room/living room, I was prepared for disaster. I was pleasantly surprised to find the room was very quiet - noise did not travel in from the common area. I would call the rooms adequate, but not elegant.The innkeeper was super nice and accommodating. Best of all was the breakfast that far surpassed the typical "breakfast included" plan.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western Ever!”
Reviews.Author: hat1521
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights of our week long anniversary trip to California. It was the best hotel of the trip! The hotel's owners are just as charming as their lovely property. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The lobby was warm and friendly with its elegant fireplace and cream colored walls. The breakfast waffles were perfect, the blueberry mini loaves were great, the fruit salad had all the good stuff (like strawberries), and the oatmeal and toppings (chocolate covered raisins, almonds, coconut!) were fabulous. The coffee and juice were great too. Our favorite part was the homemade chocolate chip cookies and milk served in the evenings! All this and the hotel is about 3 minutes to downtown Napa and very close to a great little shopping center with a Whole Foods, Target, book store and a nice inexpensive restaurant. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for a Napa inn...”
Reviews.Author: kerwei
Reviews.Content: Cosy and comfortable. So far, definitely the 'best' Best Western inn that I have stayed in hands down. In B&B terms, it is pretty great. Rooms are spacious and clean and given it is in Napa, it a steal. Having said that, I liked our quaint and cosy king premium room but I did not think it was as great as the reviews seem to suggest. Breakfast was pretty ordinary, didn't do it for me. I would still recommend it though given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is good”
Reviews.Author: JerryStockholm
Reviews.Content: It got great reviews, and it is good. The rooms are basic but: The owner is very service minded and helpful The breakfast is great The location is good The outdoor jacuzzi is very relaxing Just booked the Elm House again for my next trip to Napa

Reviews.Title: “All i can say is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Masha1977
Reviews.Content: The absolutely best hotel for economy travel... Never 've seen such friendly service, plus amazing big clean rooms, great location. Try to get rooms there even there is no availability online. Pick up the phone & they would help you. I did that for me... plus the breakfast is totally great, there is garden with loveseat, Jacuzzi...People at reception are very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: elmac40
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Elm House as part of our California vacation. We had a lovely room with a sitting room and Jacuzzi - room was very comfortable and very clean. Check in was easy and the staff were all very helpful. At around 6pm you are provided with hot cookies and milk - apparantly an American tradition but something I had never tried before - it was delicious!!! I would have no hesitation in recommending Elm House.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: srhbluerain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early May. The Elm House Inn is in a very convenient area. We were able to walk downtown to dinner (had a wonderful, laid back dinner with excellent wine at The Bounty Hunter). The rooms are no frills and our queen bed was just okay. But the room was clean and for the price, you can't beat it. The breakfast was delicious with lots of varieties including yummy fresh fruit and the best blueberry muffins I've ever had (hot too)! The owners are very friendly and welcoming. They called us a taxi for dinner one night and are helpful with recommending restaurants and wineries. There is free and convenient parking. The lobby area is very quaint and cozy. I definitely recommend for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Personable Hotel in Good, Central location”
Reviews.Author: jcool33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for one night. We had a nice, downstairs corner room. The personnel were personable, the continental breakfast was good. Great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Well deserved #1 ranking!!”
Reviews.Author: strat62
Reviews.Content: walking distance to town/shopping. one block to highway that leads to wine country. great value for the $$, friendly staff, terrific breakfast! only thing "Best Western" about it is the sign out front. really more a B & B. make sure you check out the farmers market festival downtown on thursday's if you're there in season, (food, live entertainment, etc.). great place, a solid 10 on a scale of 1-10.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: MrsMessinger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and it is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Everything from the cozy room with fire place, great staff, romantic spa, great bed & pillows, yummy milk & cookies before bed, and filling breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadnerDad
Reviews.Content: We had used Trip Advisor to find this hotel, and there is a reason it is ranked Number 1, it is an absolutely great hotel for the money. The cookies & milk in the evening and the breakfasts in the morning are fantastic. The location is good, it is not right in Downtown Napa, but it was an easy walk to the restaurants that we went to. The only slighly negative thing that I can say is that our room (201) faced the road, so I did have some road noise in the morning that woke me up (but I live in a quiet suburb, so any road noise is unusual for me).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the Valley and still close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousColorado2
Reviews.Content: I love staying at this hotel. I've been here a few times while wine tasting in the Napa and Sonoma Valleys. It is located in downtown Napa, which makes it accessible to all the restaurants in that town and is still only a few miles down the highway from all the wineries. First, don't let the Best Western chain name dissuade you. Those hotels are all individually owned which allows for wide array of accommodation types. So, on to the important things. Several small details make this hotel special and more like a bed and breakfast than a hotel.The owners are there all the time and always greet you with a smile. There are fresh flowers set around from their private garden, there are usually homemade cookies put out, breakfast again has fresh baked breads/pastries and a large variety of options to choose from, the rooms are spacious and this is not a large inn, only 22 rooms. There are several room choices. We stayed in the double queen, queen with fireplace and king with fireplace. All great options. There is plenty of room, an extra sitting area, nice closet space and bathrooms with jet tubs. We highly recommend staying here as it is less than the majority of the places in town and substantially less than places in Yountville and Rutherford. Although it is wonderful to be able to stay in those towns, if you don't have the budget, the Elm House is a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TChristy
Reviews.Content: Tom and the staff were so nice! They made us feel like we were family! Best Waffles EVER! This is very much like a B&B and I've been recommending it to all my friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just spectacular! Not what you might expect from a Best Western!!!!”
Reviews.Author: acouplefoodies
Reviews.Content: This was the first of three hotels my husband and I stayed at during our vacation in wine country and it was by far the best. In addition to the phenomenol value, the hotel was charming, comfortable and VERY welcoming. Breakfast in the morning was marvelous, the hot tub was lovely after a day of touring wineries, and the staff was very helpful. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Homey Inn in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mrspoz
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Elm House Inn and were treated like we were the only guests there! Before arriving, I spoke with Connie about an allergy issue and was assured the room would be spotless and if there was any problem I could be moved to another room. The room was absolutely immaculate and there was no need to change rooms. The bed was very comfortable, room was huge, and had the feeling of our own private space with the entrance off the beautiful courtyard. We also enjoyed the outdoor jacuzzi one afternoon. The owners run this Inn like a small bed and breakfast, with many personal touches and attention. The Belgian waffles and hot out of the oven muffins every morning were amazing, and the chocolate chip cookies at 6pm, wow! The second morning, Tom already knew our names and we felt very "at home". He was also a wealth of information on restaurants and wineries in the area we hadn't known about. We would highly recommend this Inn to anyone in the Napa area. The riverfront area was also just a short (15 min) walk away, with many shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway! Wonderful Place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: stevelaws
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Elm House Inn on TripAdvisor and were convinced to stay because of the amazing reviews. This small hotel is a gem and a great value. The room was fantastic and quiet, the location was awesome, and the service and friendliness of the staff was as good as it gets. Our only gripe is that the owner won't give us her fabulous cookie recipe! It's worth a stay just for the cookies. We also really enjoyed our breakfast each morning. Waffles made to order, great selection of high quality fresh food, AND chocolate covered raisins to put in your morning oatmeal. Brilliant!! We can't wait to come back to Napa and the Elm House Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great value!”
Reviews.Author: sglynn0419
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel that definitely feels more like a B&B than a hotel. It's small, the service is incredible and you are treated like family, and the breakfasts are the perfect way to start the day! You are about 6 blocks from downtown Napa but a very pleasant walk and it was nice to walk off dinner a bit each night before returning to our room. The room itself was fine (clean and comfortable) and we'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “....Absolutely Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: artistpalette
Reviews.Content: The staff is very pleasant and efficient. We have been visiting Napa over 30 years and this property is an excellent value. This translates to mean more to spend on wonderful wine. The room was clean and comfortable, the lighting was good.. The breakfast had more than enough variety and the quality was excellent. The ambiance of the breakfast room was like being in someone's home. We will definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Right at Home...”
Reviews.Author: swimwendy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Best Western for 3 nights during our trip to Napa. Our room was HUGE, with a wonderfully comfortable king sized bed. The breakfasts in the morning rival any fancy-pants bed and breakfast. The staff was always friendly-- they learned our names, and recalled our plans for each day. The walk into town was quiet and safe, and gave us an opportunity to see the town. The only downside was the noise from the road--our windows faced the busy street, and the first night I noticed the sound. But all the wonderful traits of this hotel made this so minor. If we ever go up to Napa again, we would definitely stay at Elm House.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: Lynda13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were quite impressed with all aspects of our 4-day stay at the Inn. Our hosts' attention to detail and the friendly staff made the Inn most welcoming and cozy. The amenities in each room were equal to any at a much more expensive hotel, including the well-chosen artwork throughout the Inn. We enjoyed an exceptionally good breakfast in the attractively decorated lobby. The selection of delicious fresh fruit, pastries, breads and waffles, slow-cooked oatmeal with condiments and assorted cereals, along with superb coffee, got our days off to a great start! A charming place all around. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Price You Can Afford”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaJohnson1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! You got the warm welcome of a bed and breakfast with the comfort of staying at a national chain. The staff was wonderful! We felt like they sincerely cared we were having a nice time when they asked about our plans. The breakfast was great - we were surprised how elegant it was! There were even snacks in the evening (cookies and milk and the like) which really made it feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “A "delicious" place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel524
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in downtown Napa. We were attending the Leo Kottke concert at the Uptown Theater. No problem walking from the hotel to downtown theater and restaurants (maybe one mile). Our room was very large and spacious. Enjoyed sitting out by the hottub in the afternoon - everyone brings a bottle of wine back from their day of tastings and enjoys. We heard people rave about the freshly baked cookies at 6pm but we missed them. The breakfast was fantastic including a delicious freshly baked mini loaf. We will definitely stay here when we hopefully return to another concert at the wonderful Uptown Theater.

Reviews.Title: “What a find! A motel with a bed & breakfast atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: dlonra01
Reviews.Content: Nothing but superlatives for this motel! Friendly and helpful staff; large, clean and comfortable rooms; delicious breakfast; convenient to downtown NAPA and wineries; reasonably priced. Wonderful hot tub to relax and enjoy your favorite wine. Would definitely recommend to friends and plan to be repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem! Home made cookies in evening & waffles in AM!! Ahhh!”
Reviews.Author: 25thannivtrip
Reviews.Content: Walked in to the smell of fresh baked cookies!! The service was superb!! Gave us a great recommendation for dinner. Had a wonderful time at dinner talking to other patrons and great food and beer! It reminded me of a B&B, not a hotel. Close to downtown, shopping and wine tasting. Just planned on spending the night, but spent the whole day exploring the area. This was our favorite place we stayed at on our 10 day 25th anniv. trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quaint, & Warm”
Reviews.Author: HawnGolferGirl
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we knew this place would be a special experience. The staff was warm, curtious, and friendly. The lobby/living room/dining room reminded me of grandma's house and when the chocolate chip cookies were served.........well......you get the picture!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stya”
Reviews.Author: JodiRoss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elm House with friends of ours. We thought it had great accommodations and that it was in a great location. Their breakfast is wonderful, the rooms are nice and clean and the hot tub warm! We definitely would recommend staying here and when we come back to Napa will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: psgcarca
Reviews.Content: Perfect retreat to visit the Napa Valley. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: m0m2girls
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful, nothing like you picture when you think best western. We stayed for 5 nights and everything couldn't have been better. The room was very large, nicely decorated and clean. Breakfast every morning was very good with a large variety. All of the people were very friendly and helpful we were given very good reccomendations were to go for shops and food. We would absolutly stay here again and reccomend this hotel to anyone, It was the best overall hotel experience we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly welcome awaits you at this comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: suekmar
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most welcoming and comfortable hotels we have stayed in while travelling through America. The owners and staff couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was amazing, it was like a mini guest house and every comfort had been thought of. We even had wine glasses in our room. The superb complementary breakfast included home make cakes and waffles. Afternoon tea and coffee came with more home made cakes. This award winning hotel is one to visit. The only down side it's about 1 mile from downtown Napa and the restaurants so you have to drive somewhere to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Traffic noise was a problem...”
Reviews.Author: candyshores
Reviews.Content: Our room faced the highway exit ramp intersection, and traffic noise interfered with TV and conversation. Traffic included motorcycles and trucks decelerating and accelerating nearby, rather than a distant hum of cars. Napa is a city with traffic, not like the smaller towns slightly north. Despite the cookies and breakfast, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What all Best Westerns should be”
Reviews.Author: dwfilice
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Elm House Inn is a very nice cross between a Bed & Breakfast and a regular BW Inn or hotel. The staff was very helpful, attentive and timely. The grounds are beautiful, very much like an English Garden surrounded by a nice Inn. The Inn is split into two sections: A main building with several rooms, the lobby and nice casual breakfast room with fireplace: A back building with just a few deluxe rooms. My wife and I stayed in one of the back deluxe king rooms upstairs that was very nice, quiet and private and separated from the main office area by beautiful gardens. Our friends stayed here too and they had equally high marks for the Elm House Inn. The BW Elm House Inn served breakfast, which was Continental by hotel standards but just perfect for us: Belgium waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, cereals, juices. We've had Continental Breakfasts at other hotels that were nothing more than plastic-wrapped pastries. Not here. There was a full staff of servers who helped make breakfast an enjoyable event. Aside from the Wi-Fi internet service, we had a lobby computer to use and the staff was very helpful in printing our boarding passes. I highly recommend the Elm House Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon everything we wanted and more !!!”
Reviews.Author: target32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elm House Inn for our honeymoon March 21-25 and this place was AWESOME !!! When we arrived they already knew it was our honeymoon and gave us a great room (401) that was huge. Very, very comfortable king size bed and an enormous bathroom with a standalone shower and Jacuzzi tub in it which was very nice. The walk in closet that was in the room also had another vanity with sink, mirror and hair dryer which made it very nice for 2 people to get ready without crowding each other. The room was very quiet at night and I am not sure what rooms others stayed in but we were no more than 20 feet from the street and never once heard any noise in our room. We faced out into the little courtyard they have there and next to the hot tub which made our nights very relaxing. This hotel is more like a B&B than your average hotel. The owners Tom and Connie knew us on a first name basis and made absolute sure we were having a great stay at their place. Each night they made us reservations at whatever restaurant we were going to which made it nice to not have to deal with that sort of thing on our honeymoon. This was our first trip to Napa and we could not have picked a better place to stay. The location is great, the room was awesome. The owners were unbelievable and the cost was right where we needed to be. When we visit Napa again (and we will) we will for sure be staying at the Elm House Inn again. I can really not write enough about this hotel and everyone there. It was a fantastic time and we are so glad we were able to enjoy our trip and our honeymoon with no hassles and at a such great location. Thank You !!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best of the Best Western hotels !”
Reviews.Author: AndreHamel
Reviews.Content: Warm reception, first class room, helpfull. Complimentary breakfast is just amazing ! A MUST return asap.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: swbkrun
Reviews.Content: The highlight of staying at the Elm House is the wonderful breakfast! They go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need, from a home made waffle to a fresh baked chocolate chip cookie. Very, very friendly staff. It sits right on a busy corner, so that is a downfall. But if you don't mind the traffic noise, it's a nice place to stay on your visit to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the reviews said it would be and more”
Reviews.Author: twocitygal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all that the reviews said it would be and more. The hotel and our room was extremely clean and well maintained. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rbassoi
Reviews.Content: I'm from Brazil but love to travel worldwide and stay in good hotels. When I did the reservation I was a little bit worry because of the size of hotel and the expectation after reading the reviews here. When we arrive I just can say that Tom make my day with a warm reception! The hotel is perfect, ideal for couples. Hotel and Rooms absolutely clean and what I can say about Cookies in the afternoon and Pancakes in the Breakfest? Amazing!!!! Congrats to Tom and spouse for the great hotel. For sure will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AZW9LVER
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for us. We went back and forth researching all kinds of places, inns, B&B's, resorts trying to decide whether to stay here or somewhere further north in Napa. I am so glad we stayed here. This price is great from the level of comfort and service you recieve. It was just so cozy and comfortable. The rooms were clean and not overdone. It was more like a large house than an Inn and its actually smaller than it looks in the pics which I was happy with. It was like being at a B&B only its not that intrusive, if you want privacy ,you have it and its a very quiet location too even though its off the freeway. There is no reason to pay more for an expensive resort or spa. Just what we needed, quiet and cozy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jchristian23
Reviews.Content: Would not stay any other place when I return to the Napa area. The owners and the entire staff go out of their weay to make you feel at home. The rooms are enormous and beautiful. The location and value are unbeatable. The breakfast in the morning and the cookies at night are absolutely fabulous as well. You would have to be crazy to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel I've stayed at in recent memory.”
Reviews.Author: Katie_AB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my favourite hotel of my 3-week vacation in California. I would recommend this hotel to everyone traveling in Napa Valley! I stayed here for three nights and was sorry I couldn't stay longer! As a solo traveler, I was looking for a place where I felt safe and where I could feel at home. This hotel was all of that and more - the room was huge and clean, the location was central to everything you might need, and the breakfast in the morning was incredible. The thing that stands-out most about this hotel, though, is the incredible staff - they know guests by name and go above and beyond to make everyone feel welcome and help to make their stay in Napa Valley wonderful. They will call to make reservations, advise you on the best wineries to visit, and help with anything you need. (They even checked the traffic for me when I was leaving to drive to the San Francisco airport.) The rate was so reasonable (I recommend going in the off-season for the best rates at hotels and attractions!) I will be back to this hotel for sure next time I'm in Napa Valley!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room with Best Value in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: ARGIGGLES
Reviews.Content: Our stay was only for one night, but it was great. The room was spacious with everything we needed. Huge bathroom with an extra vanity to get ready without stumbling over each other. The breakfast was wonderful, especially the Waffles. We would have stayed the whole week at Elm House if we weren't wine tasting in/around St Helena. The Elm House is the best price around and especially for the room size, and amenities. Great Place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: jrsound
Reviews.Content: Really lovely. Spotlessly clean. Very friendly and helpful. Great home baked cookies! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little place that feels like a cozy bed and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and loved it. Fantastic value, wonderful staff. Very helpful. Great breakfast every morning-everything from fresh berries to waffles and cereals. Cozy fireplace. Would stay here again and would have expected to pay much more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: West_LA_GIRL68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elm House the week of January 24 for two nights. It was a very lovely hotel. Everyone was super nice. The housekeeping staff was amazing and also really nice. Close to where I wanted and needed to be. The rooms were spacious and the location was great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would tell all of my friends to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarikoH
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Elm House Inn for three nights at the end of January. This Inn is fabulous! It is very centrally located to all the Napa Valley wineries and the staff there is incredible. They know how to accommodate, please and make their guests happy. They were very helpful with printing of boarding passes, maps to locations and if there is a question they don’t know how to answer, they looked it up and got back to us. They had a box of treasure (coupons and two-for-one for the wineries) that they gladly shared with us. The lobby has a very cozy fireplace where we loved gathering around. The breakfast was better than continental with yummy fruit parfaits, muffins, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, and made to order waffles or toasted bagels or English muffins. In the evening they had the best chocolate chip cookies that melted in your mouth. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: lserpiello
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Elm House from 1/16-1/23. The entire staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. Tom the innkeeper was so friendly and helpful. He even allowed us to use the computer behind the desk when they experienced some problems with the laptop they offer for guest use. Their delicious breakfasts helped fuel us up for sight-seeing and we came home to fresh baked cookies each night (we joked that we could never eat like this at home.) Our top 3 restaurant experiences were Rutherford Grill, Rotisserie & Wine (Tyler Florence's new place) and Neela's Indian (sorry we waited till our last night, this deserved a second visit.) The Elm House Inn will always be our home away from home on future travels to the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Terrific Hotel, and hot cookies!”
Reviews.Author: littlegirlblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House Inn, along with 10 other relatives in 5 other rooms, and the weekend stay was excellent. Very pleasant staff and owners, the rooms are clean and very nice, the common area/breakfast/living room is beautiful, room-to-room and street noise are non-existent, and overall we really liked the place. Parking is free and easy, Hwy 29 and downtown Napa are only a few blocks away, and the neighborhood is very walkable. Our only issue was with a very loud bathroom fan that went on whenever the bathroom light was turned on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, clean, friendly and outstanding breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sbgatch
Reviews.Content: Not your typical Best Western, more like a bed and breakfast. Fresh baked treat every evening, along with clean rooms, cozy bed and linens, conveniently located to Napa Valley. Yummy breakfast with homemade waffles, fresh oatmeal with walnuts, berries, along with a variety of other choices. Great way to start your day ....

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Average Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swireland
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable stay in the heart of Napa. Easy access to all wineries and the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. Great waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice And Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: freecia
Reviews.Content: We booked two double rooms over the NYE holiday and received 2 2nd floor rooms. Both overlooked parking lots on different sides of the building but were quiet except for a few footsteps from 3rd floor guests. Since we arrived early and the hotel was booked, they allowed us to store a cake in the downstairs refrigerator while we went winery touring. Rooms were ready when we got back in the late afternoon. Rooms were comfortable and clean. This isn't one of the 5* spa resorts like others in this area, so if you want a marble bathroom, gourmet room service, heated pool, and majestic view, book one of those and pay the higher rates. It is the cutest Best Western I've been to and resembles a mid-size Bed and Breakfast more than a chain hotel. Frankly I'd rather use the "saved" money towards the fabulous eateries! We happened to get some glitter from wrapping paper on the floor and bedspread; housekeeping had it all cleaned up by the time we got back in during the evening. Nice to know they vacuum while guests are in residence, not just between guests. Blankets in our room were red pseudo-suede duvet covers and very comfortable. We had a small sink outside the bathroom as well as another inside. Tub was a little shallower than standard but also very clean. Breakfast was fantastic! Tea (w/ Stash tea bags) at most times as well. I'm a tea drinker and usually water from the hot water thermal carafe tastes like coffee but no such problems here! Could get water from the carafe or if it is out, ask the person at the front desk. I believe they put out a laptop in the downstairs sitting area after breakfast for guest use. We had our own devices and were able to connect to the various free wifi spots. If one network is slow, be sure to try the others. Tips: I'd avoid the 1st floor rooms in the main building if you'd like to sleep in. They let out directly into the breakfast area. The hotel also has a box of coupons for local wineries. During our stay they had 2 for 1 coupons for tastings and etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Bestest Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: Nevada_Kate
Reviews.Content: This Best Western was the best ever! It had lovely rose gardens, a nice breakfast in the morning, freshly baked cookies in the afternoon, and tea and coffee all the time. And the rooms were great, too! Clean, spacious, comfortable. All at an unbelievably low price! I've never stayed in a nice hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a night away in Napa”
Reviews.Author: traveling066
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms the Best Western Elm House Inn last month largely because it was rated #1 in Napa on TripAdvisor. The rooms are very reasonably priced. The parking was free. The hotel's location was fine - directly off the highway and a fifteen or twenty minute walk into town for dinner. Many of the staff members were helpful and cheerful - the restaurant they recommended for dinner (Zuzu) was very pleasant. Our rooms at the Elm House Inn were simple, big - the common area and entrance have a cozy feel that the hotel rooms lack. The bathroom fan in my room was broken. I was, in truth, disappointed when I was told at the front desk that it couldn't be fixed during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to a friend because it is a reasonably priced play to stay in Napa. That said, I'd likely suggest they also consider other Napa hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: vacationjason
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised when my travel agent, Parul at Highline Travel.com, recommended a "chain hotel" for our Napa Valley trip. But this hotel is anything but a chain. The service was excellent and the rooms were charming with so much character. We stayed in a room with a gas fireplace. Between the daytime wine tasting activities that Parul had set up for us and evening fireplace reading, our Napa Valley Trip was planned perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service, Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly29
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Staff very helpful, excellent breakfast included with homemade touches. Hotel was charming. We walked easily to downtown Napa and Wine Train tour. Definately would recommend. Great Value. Enjoyed the hot tub in small garden, lovely setting and really appreciated that there were laundry facilities available to guest. Good location to drive to outlet mall and other shopping and walk to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fireplace in the room for a romantic stay in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: malinowynet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights to drive around the Wine Country. It's a perfect location to visit Napa and Sonoma Valleys, only an hour drive from San Francisco. Point Reyes National Seashore, Muir Woods and Bodega Bay are the same distance with some scenic roads. Furthermore, there is a big outlet right across the highway! The room we got was great, with a very nice interior and a gas fireplace. Very comfortable, hotel also provides brochures about Napa and the wineries. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is great, especially for those who like it sweet! There are even freshly baked Belgian waffles. Taking everything into account, great hotel to stay in Napa, different than the chain hotels, with amazing ambience. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer101Uk
Reviews.Content: The service here was without doubt the best I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing. The staff and owners couldn't do enough to make your stay as comfortable as possible. From fresh baked cookies when we checked in at 6pm to freshly made waffles for breakfast. It doesn't look like anything too special from the outside and is a bit of a walk from the centre of Napa... but all of that is made up for by the quality of your stay here. They are also full of good recommendations for where to eat and drink. Just ask them to tell you about the restaurant with the beer can chicken. Awesome. Book it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Just make the reservation...you won't be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: rikivy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while touring Napa vineyards. Very warm and inviting from the moment we checked in. Owners and staff are very friendly and literally can't do enough to make your stay a pleasant one. Lobby is lovely with a fireplace and breakfast nook where freshly baked cookies are put out each evening and a breakfast of waffles, fresh fruit, freshly bakes muffins, cereals, yogurts etc. greets you each morning. Our room was lovely,very clean, beautiflly decorated and large! Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: frankstrong
Reviews.Content: What a gem. Super clean room, wonderful breakfast, great hosts. We will be returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay...lovely inn!”
Reviews.Author: Yodee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House Inn last night. I am hard-pressed to find anything we didn't like about the place! We had a king room with jacuzzi tub, fireplace and included a great continental breakfast. First, the room: Extremely comfortable, clean and had everything we needed for a comfortable and happy stay. The bed was comfortable & nice plush pillows and comforter. The fireplace added a lovely, romantic touch to an already great room. The location: About 1/2 mile from downtown Napa- only a 3 minute drive so that cool. Interestingly, it was right off the freeway (29) but we were not at all disturbed by sounds of traffic. They have a small (free) parking lot with about 6 spaces. The breakfast: YUMMY. It was more than a continental breakfast, with yogurt, lots of fruit, oatmeal (with toppings including brown sugar, walnuts, coconut, chocolate covered raisins (!) and cranberries, cereal, bagels, muffins and BOMB waffles:), plus really good coffee. Lots of carbs, for sure, but enough to get you going for the day. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly without being over-the-top saccharine. All in all we had a perfect stay and would definitely go back for our next visit to Napa or surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: AshUVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in Napa! It was comparable to a B&B that we've stayed in before that cost us twice the price! Even though its a Best Western, it feels like a B&B. Its rather small (not too many rooms) and cozy, the breafast is yummy and varied, and the personal attention great! The owners are wonderfuly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Champagneandcupcakes
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, bed was comfy, service and breakfast were good. I thought it was reasonably priced and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Bocarob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House for a long weekend and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located just south of the trails where all the wineries are. The room was huge, clean, and very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious, clean, and neatly decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had some really good night sleeps there. The owners are really friendly and willing to make dinning and winery suggestions as well as provide coupons for free and 2 for 1 tastings. The breakfast was very good including the cozy dining room where they serve it. As everyone states, the Belgian waffles are freaking awesome! There was a discrepancy between what I had booked using Expedia and what they wanted to charge me for two of the nights. They said Expedia had made a mistake and that they needed to investigate. They were very nice about it and kept in touch with me frequently after we had left to let me know the status of the conversations they were having with Expedia. At the end, they honored the rate which Expedia had quoted me so I was obviously pleased with the outcome. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, super nice people and great value”
Reviews.Author: TakeItToGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 month old. They went the extra mile to help us find restaurants that were kid friendly, they upgraded us to a bigger room, and were just ridiculously friendly and helpful on any occasion possible. For example, they saw that we brought home takeout one night because our baby was too fussy to stay at the restaurant and they offered to bring up plates and silverware to our room. Sure, it's a Best Western and doesn't have all the frills and Hugh design of a five star, but it is super clean, well located and the service is enough to make you want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stop debating and book a room here!”
Reviews.Author: stoty67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Elm House Inn for our trip to Napa/Sonoma. We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor, but we had no idea just how good it was going to be...it is excellent. It's definitely an inn; small, cozy and tasteful. Breakfasts were great...specialty waffles and freshly baked breakfast muffins hit the spot. The service was impeccable...the owners really went above and beyond to help their customers. We were close to downtown, but we never walked. Restaurants/nightlife was just a 2-minute car ride away. Our room was in the building adjacent to the main building...just through the garden. The room was twice the size of an average hotel room and had a walk in closet and had an additional and separate vanity area. The inn looks like no other Best Western I've ever seen. We couldn't wait to get home and write a positive review and attach a couple of pictures to help the undecided! One review said it best...'the money we saved by staying here we spent on wine!' The great rates and the little-inn atmosphere are a great combination. We'd love to stay again on another trip to the area, and we'll definitely recommend it to our friends and family. Great job Elm House Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiCalif
Reviews.Content: From the cleanliness of the hotel to the wonderful staff, this hotel lives up to the previous reviews. Breakfast included waffles (and pumpkin waffles for the season!) and the evening snack was cookies and milk. The location is convenient to all of the Napa Valley. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “This is a Bed and Breakfast (not Best Western)”
Reviews.Author: t-j-Mill
Reviews.Content: This is way more than the Best Western that your family stayed in when you were a kid. Room was huge, breakfast was awesome, people were great, parking was easy, price was outstanding, bed was super comfy...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel While Exploring Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: KFish074
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect place to stay while exploring Napa for the first time on our honeymoon. The Hotel Staff was excellent and very willing to help us find places to visit or locations for dinner (they were even willing to to make the reservations). We felt very comfortable the entire time we were there. Try the cookies and milk at night! The room was very spacious and clean. There was plenty of parking and it was very easy to find. Very close to downtown. This hotel is certainly highly recommended for those that want to enjoy all that Napa has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “More like a B&B”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Very small hotel located in Napa. Rooms very in size with our room (103) being a nice size and great location just off the lobby. Breakfast is served with a lot of love and the waffles are great! Late afternoon cookies are homemade and yummy. Nice walk to downtown for dinner and shopping. Owner happy to make suggestions for dinner. As always opinions can differ in that my wife and I loved this small B&B like hotel, while the friends we travelled with thought the hotel was small and overpriced wishing they had stayed down the street at a large chain hotel. This place would probably be better classified in the B&B section of TripAdvisor, but either way we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and terrific service”
Reviews.Author: cloverWLA
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights at then Inn when we visited Napa to celebrate my 10/10/10 birthday and were very pleased with the Elm House's cozy and charming atmosphere. The owner and his staff were very attentive to our needs and so friendly! The breakfasts were much nicer than the typical Continental fare, including the cooked-to-order waffles, the house-made mini-loaves (lemon poppy and banana walnut), and everything we ate was fresh and tasty. The late-afternoon chocolate chip cookies were great! We stayed in Room 207, which was huge and nicely appointed, including a fireplace and a jacuzzi tub. The location is a few minutes drive from Downtown Napa and well-situated for touring all the beautiful area wineries. We have already recommended the Inn to our friends and next time we visit Napa, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: SkysMomLR
Reviews.Content: I am "knit-picky" when it comes to a clean hotel. This small hotel is quaint, clean and has the best service. The beds are comfortable and so are the pillows. Sheets are crisp and clean. We only stayed one night and missed the nightly homemade cookies at 5 pm so the lady at the front desk saved our cookies....what a treat! They also serve brunch which was incrediblly delicious. Homemade pumpkin bread was great. The front desk clerk packed us some bread to go for our trip to Sausalito....how nice was that?! I would definitely stay there again. Only one caveat...some rooms are on the second level which requires ascending stairs and might be difficult for some so tell them if you have limitations when making your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Clean”
Reviews.Author: TT777_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elm House Inn for nearly a week for our one-year anniversary. Our room was spacious and clean and included a marble gas fireplace and a Jacuzzi tub. Though our room faced the main road, we never were really disturbed by the traffic. There are no microwaves or room safes, but the staff is kind enough to warm up your leftovers for you and will keep your valuables in a hotel safe upon request. Be sure to book a room early because there were no vacancies during our stay, and if you book a lobby-level room, be prepared to possibly hear noise from the breakfast crowd because the food is set up outside of those rooms. The Inn staff is very warm and hospitable; I witnessed staff members go the extra mile on several occasions (e.g., providing directions, making tour arrangements, picking roses for in-room dining trays, and ensuring that guests enjoyed the complimentary breakfast). Also, I affirm that the waffles and cookies are as delicious as other reviews have noted! We recommend a rental car to get to nearby restaurants and shopping centers. We also recommend speaking with hotel staff about vineyard tours and hot air balloon rides. We enjoyed the following at the Inn: + flat screen TV with many cable channels + board games and books in lobby + nice bath products We had the following minor criticisms: - A/C unit and Jacuzzi were slightly noisy - dated Jacuzzi tub and toilet - quiet hours after 10 pm (definitely isn't a place for party people; luckily my husband and I are not) - no meat provided at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: flower1_23_07
Reviews.Content: While this is classified as a hotel, the ambiance is more like a B&B with superieor service.We arrived at the hotel early in the morning to meet our Wine Tour and although we had not yet checked in we were invited into the warm cozy lobby to have breakfast. The owners and staff made us feel welcome from the first moment to the last of our stay, helping us with dinner recommendations and reservations, activities, directions, taxis, etc. We felt like treasured guests for the duration of our stay and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The rooms were spacious and well equipped. We were upgraded the first night, but not disappointed at all with the "standard" room we moved to for night 2. I can't say enough about the quality of the service and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Napa vacation get-away”
Reviews.Author: LoveItalian106
Reviews.Content: This seemed more like an intimate bed and breakfast rather than a hotel chain. We loved everything about it! The owners were friendly and helpful in making the arrangements for our dinners and made some helpful suggestions. They also had a wonderful tradition of a fireside manager's complimentary wine party every evening. What a classy place! We'd love to go visit once again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: vfarnell
Reviews.Content: A great little place to spend an evening. The owners really care abotu their guests and are delightfully helpful. THe cookies in the evening were delicious and the waffles at breakfast were scrumptious! We will definately stay here when we visit the area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Little Dark Inn”
Reviews.Author: amc1958
Reviews.Content: Walked in to the "Inn", and immediately wondered why Best Western would have ever allowed their name on the outside. Musty smell, poorly lit hallways, disgusting bedspreads, very small rooms. There was a fireplace, but you would have had to sit on the bed to even see the fireplace! Old rug in the bathroom. Poor quality facility for such a lovely part of the country... Best Western you better take a good look at this place with your name on it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ProudCanadians
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this great hotel that is more like a b&b. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. The gardens out back are beautiful. Breakfast every morning was delicious. And the front desk staff and owners were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bed & Breakfast Experience in Napa”
Reviews.Author: timothydog76
Reviews.Content: We finished out our 9 day vacation of the San Francisco Bay Area with a two day stay in Napa. The high ratings drove us to stay here even though it was the most expensive place we stayed in all of our trip (Downtown San Francisco & Monterey Included). The building has a very cozy feel to it and the staff was very friendly. If you can afford it, request room 207. It seemed to be the biggest in the whole place. One of the largest rooms I've ever stayed in. Pictures attached for proof. There was a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom as well which was nice and I loved the extra room for showering as well. The room was very clean overall and the bed was very comfy. They even supply you with a couple nice white robes in the closet. There is no swimming pool but there was a hot tub out back. It's very warm and relaxing. Grab the robes after a long day of sightseeing and head out there at night. The included breakfast is pretty much the nicest continental type breakfast I've had and, since the place only has 20 rooms or so, there aren't any mad lines or rushing. The lobby is also filled with tons of info for sightseeing and also a little box with coupons for free winetesting. Look for it! Free fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and milk on ice are served in the lobby at 6PM every night as well. They are to die for! I highly recommend this Inn to anyone staying in the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: stephvaca
Reviews.Content: Wow! What are you people thinking? This is definately a 2 star hotel! Cookies and a good breakfast shouldn't make this hotel #1 on trip advisory! I was very disappointed. This is the first time trip advisory has let me down. The room was very old and outdated! Definately a typical Best Western or Motel 6 quality!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property - Fantastic Owners”
Reviews.Author: Gatorpapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House only one night and we wished that we could have stayed there the entire week. We were given room 402 - a huge and beautifully appointed king size room. There was a separate toilet, shower, sink area, and also a large sink in a separate area. This was great as my wife and I weren't bumping into each other getting ready in the morning. The owners were fantastic. They were at our disposal for information the entire stay. The breakfast was plentiful, and included very fresh fruit and a delicious waffle made and served by the owner. This was more like a large bed and breakfast than a hotel/motel. I would totally recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mm9876
Reviews.Content: We visited Napa on our first trip to California and absolutely loved staying at Elm House. The owners Connie and Tom made us feel really welcome from the outset and the breakfast was really great. The homemade cookies that they put out every day at 6pm were awesome. Id definitely recommend the hotel. Its around a mile to walk to the shops and restaurants and parking wasnt a problem. A good base to explore Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Most Welcome in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Bruce R
Reviews.Content: We reserved rooms 402 and 403 following the recommendation of previous Tripadvisor commentators. It is a B & B, and we were made most welcome and were served great breakfasts. The family were most helpful with recommendations for local restaurants and attractions. We would not hesitate to suggest that others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Way Above It's Pay Grade In Terms Of Quality-- Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: ArubaHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect. It's totally not what you would expect, being that it's a Best Western [not that that means it can't be nice] but it was like a little Boutique inn more than a hotel. Nice rooms, gorgeous building and grounds, and free delicious breakfast. Right off Hwy 29, perfect location. We would and will stay there again. Oh, did I mention it blows the pants off the other comparable places in the area in price? Sure, you could stay at a $450/night bed and breakfast, but if you're staying in your room that much while in the valley, you might as well not go. YOU SHOULD BE OUTSIDE ENJOYING THE WINE. ;-) Definitely recommend this place. (And it's got free wifi...)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBeaver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elm House Inn during our honeymoon roadtrip for 2 nights. The staff is amazing - when they give recommendations for dining/tours, take them! They know their stuff. Great atmosphere, great breakfast, great cookies, and the staff will bend over backwards for you. Comfy rooms too, and in the detached guesthouse, there is a walk-in closet bigger than some bedrooms I've had. Cozy hot tub in the nicely landscaped courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Elm House - Treemendous”
Reviews.Author: LyeCon
Reviews.Content: First impression - the Elm House does not seem to be a typical Best Western, with a homely and intimate air as you walk in, and no sign of corporate conformity. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, and the rooms well appointed with his 'n her basins (she gets the bathroom!) Lots of space, and comfortable bed lends itself to a good night sleep. The Inn is on quite a busy road, but the traffic dies down a lot overnight, and the gentle hum of the aircon diffuses any other street noise. The dining area is lovely, with the sun streaming in, breakfasts are a real treat, and later on in the day provides a warm and ambient setting to savour a complimentary glass of wine and muffin. Great position, not too far from downtown, and the Valley, which is what Napa stands for. A fine B&B, liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem in Napa”
Reviews.Author: bajanboy66
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here at this Best Western Elm House Inn on our recent ten day trip down the CA coast. It is an excellent hotel in a good location within the Napa area. Downtown Napa is near to the other wine towns if you have a car so it was worth the money we saved on hotels to stay here. We had the best hotel experience in a long time. At check-in Connie at the front desk told us about their breakfast and the cookies baked fresh each day at 6pm. Breakfast was outstanding….fresh fruit and freshly baked pastries!!!! Great Bed & Breakfast feel to this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful….our room was very clean and comfortable. At night we soaked our bodies in the jacuzzi. A true gem in the Napa area where there are a lot of hotels that are overpriced merely because of their location. We’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “do you feel lucky?”
Reviews.Author: BobZoom
Reviews.Content: So much about staying here depends on the room you're given. Most of the rooms are nice, many are not. If you get a nice room you'll love the place. If you get a not so nice room you'll wonder what everyone is raving about. I've stayed here twice in the past, both times during off season, and stayed in a decent room each time. You have to understand Napa when rating rooms and services there. Napa isn't about staying at the Four Seasons resort. So you have to adjust your ratings scale accordingly, if for no other reason than to be fair. Most of the rooms here are good, so my guess is your chances of getting a nice room is about 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious baked items morning & night”
Reviews.Author: MarshaOwen
Reviews.Content: Service excellent! Breakfast delicious & plenty of options. Room has some little niceties like cotton swabs & cotton balls & wine glasses. Has more of the feel of a house than hotel. Overall, lovely & would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - 1st Time Tripadvisor reviews mislead us”
Reviews.Author: 123Luv2travel123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel for pleasure on a monthly basis and often use tripadvisor to pick our hotels/restaurants. Unfortunately, this is the first time we felt very disappointed by our selection based upon tripadvisor reviews. Perhaps our expectations were too high based on the reviews, but we found this hotel to be just average at best. The room was small and the bathroom was very outdated. The room was also noisy due to the hotel's proximity to the street. Although many classify this as a B&B, to us it seemed like just a regular hotel with sub-standard size rooms that served breakfast (most hotels we've stayed at in Napa also serve complimentary breakfast). Breakfast was good, not great. The only thing cooked to order were waffles. They were good for one breakfast, but by the 2nd/3rd day we wished there was more variety. We have stayed at several other hotels in the Napa/Yountville area and all of them had breakfast (most included) which were far superior to this one. The afternoon baked goods were delicious, but there were hardly enough made for all of the guests to enjoy. The friendliness of the staff was just standard although during breakfast it seemed to pick up a bit. Perhaps we were there on an "off weekend", but we definitely won't be going back here. Housekeeping knocked on our door for literally 2 seconds and then proceeded to enter without even giving us a chance to get to the door.
