We were next to the elevator, and had no problems with noise from the elevator or other rooms. Excellent stay! One warning: we flew in to San Francisco, rented a car from Payless Rent-a-car, and drove to Napa. We had mechanical problems and Payless employees were very unhelpful. We also had a bad experience with Payless in Denver, and will never rent from Payless again. They are the cheapest car rental for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: hizzys
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Simply put, it's one of the best bed and breakfast style places i have ever been too, even though thats not how it is listed. We just got engaged and were staying at this hotel and believe me that staying there was a real treat! In the afternoon they had warm cookies and for breakfast they fed us large belgin waffles. What more could you ask for? The inn staff were simply incredible and friendly all the time. Made us both feel like we were at home, especially since they decorated the lobby with Christmas decor. The bed was listed as a queen, but they were more like a king and were super comfortable. The only two very very minor complaints that i have is that the fireplace room isn't real wood (just gas), and the soap that is provided had some black spots in it which were kinda rough on my skin (natural to the soap itself). Other than those very minor complaints, this place is simply one of the best properties around!

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Best Western! Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: MHank
Reviews.Content: This Inn was so wonderful in many areas. When you first walk in it is very inviting with a lovely lobby with a sofa and chairs around a fireplace with fresh baked cookies and hot apple cider available. The staff was very friendly and even recommended a nice spot for dinner and offered to call to make a reservation for us! The room was super cute and extremely clean! Comfortable bed and great decor!!! We were in the "new" building that is not attached to the original and has parking that is off the main busy road. We will stay here again the next time we visit Napa and will recommend to everyone we know! Also a great breakfast with waffles made by request and multiple other treats! Can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Napa! Feels like a B&B, in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: Callie_44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with friends and LOVED it! The staff was exceptionally helpful and the breakfast is to die for. It's the greatest continental breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. We made sure to get a freshly made waffle every morning. The cookies in the afternoon was a nice touch too. So good! Other bonuses.... we had two sinks in our double room. So one was in the bathroom itself and one was right outside. This made getting ready in the morning a breeze. No more waiting on one another to get ready. Free (and ample) parking was also a big plus. No matter what time we came and went, we never had problems parking when we came back. There is also a Safeway a few blocks from the hotel. This was nice because it allowed us to get a big case of water to keep in the room/car. And we definitely went through it. Overall, I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Napa. Who knew a Best Western could feel like a cozy B&B??

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RobertsMom
Reviews.Content: Lovely Inn. We recently stayed here during a weekend trip to Napa. Our room was well appointed. The Inn has a secret garden in the back. Breakfast was prepared and ready for us daily. There was always a nice snack in the evenings when we arrived back at the Inn. The staff was friendly and helpful. They are well organized and able to get you suggestions on restaurants and area attractions. I've attached a picture of the main lobby that I took - we stayed right before Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: tipsytravler
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Elm House. Very clean, comfortable beds, lovely ambiance. Yes it is on a busy street but when you walk through the inviting lobby and smell the fresh cider and feel the warmth from the fireplace all is right with the world. Excellent Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great, even on busy corner!”
Reviews.Author: RevuR
Reviews.Content: Room 402: This room is really amazingly large with a king bed. It has a cute little bump out where the desk is located, making the room seem even larger. Not all rooms have this kind of ambience as the Elm House is really in 2 buildings, one of which is right on a busy street. We found that even though the room was large, it seemed a little dark and definitely needed a floor lamp. The hotel is located right off Route 29 and is right off the ramp. Mapquest and GPS units will probably be confusing for this reason. Breakfast was fresh and lovely. We really enjoyed staying here and would again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: PhilGab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon for 3 nights before heading to San Fran. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding restaurants nearby. We got a great rate ($139) on a deluxe room and stayed on the second floor in the old building. I would not recommend staying on the first floor, especially in rooms 104 & 105 as they are directly outside the dining area and lack some privacy and could be noisy in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Weekend In The #1 Inn”
Reviews.Author: OTBART1
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal and have been using the tripadvisor website reviews to choose my hotel destinations. I have not once been disappointed in my choices. Again, I chose the #1 hotel in Napa Valley and I am forever grateful that it was perfect for the women in my family to celebrate 2 of our birthdays. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The four of us stepped into a Bed and Breakfast feel that was welcoming with fresh cookies and apple cider, followed by warm smiles from Tom. The room was very clean with plenty of space for all of us. Upon our return from a great dinner at Bistro Don Giovanni the fireplace was roaring and we sat down by the fire with our glass of wine purchased from a great winery Chateau Montelena (Calistoga). After a quick dip in the hot tub we headed back to our room. The next morning we woke up to the smells of fresh Belgium waffles and fresh squeezed orange juice. The staff were very attentative and quick to make us feel like we were special. It was sad to leave, but we have decided to make this a yearly trip and I will be calling Tom soon to book us a room, this time for 2 nights. Thanks again to Tom and the staff at the ELM HOUSE INN for making our stay feel like were at home.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met some friends and family for a few days of wine tasting. We picked Elm Street based on some reviews. It was a third the price of places in the area (my brother paid three times our price). We were surprised by the care of the owners and the service. We were treated like old friends. The rooms were older, but well maintained. We had a fireplace. Breakfast was provided. It was more like a bed and breakfast than a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Elm House Inn”
Reviews.Author: Susan038
Reviews.Content: The Elm House Inn was a great place to stay during our visit to Napa Valley. Connie and Tom the Inn Keepers were gracious hosts and the staff was friendly and very helpful. I took my parents and they were not sure about staying here, but once they walked in and saw how lovely the Inn was that took away any and all doubts. Beds were very comfortable and room nice and clean. Waffles were delicious each morning and cookies were a special afternoon treat. I loved the fresh flowers that Connie brings in from the San Francisco flower market and the fire place in the evening was so relaxing after dinner. All the other guests were very friendly and everyone was just enjoying their choice of the Inn for their stay in Napa Valley. I will definitely return to the Elm House and tell my friends about this treasure. Elm House is located in a great location for getting on Hwy 29 and close to downtown Napa. We also did lunch on the Wine Train in the Vista Dome car and that was excellant. Was raining that day, but we still had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lotsanivanh
Reviews.Content: after reading all of the positive reviews we made a reservation to stay at the elm house inn. upon recommendations of other reviewers we requested an outter room and were given room 402, which was not a typical hotel room but rather a nice sized suite. the high ceilings were a plus. the mini fridge located in the powder room was pretty convenient also. i am not sure how recent the renovations were done, but everything appeared new and decor was done relatively tastefully. in the morning we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast including belgian waffles, fruits, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, juice and hot beverages. it was a nice way to start the morning. overall, we were very pleased with our stay at the inn. we would definitely return if we needed accomodations in napa and hope that next time will be a longer stay. due to our overall pleasant experience i felt compelled to share a review and attach some photos as well. unfortunately from the photos the feeling of being at a bed and breakfast rather than a hotel chain is not captured, but i hope it is helpful for those who are looking for a nice place to stay. and thank you everyone for your reviews and steering us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected treat”
Reviews.Author: 6pack
Reviews.Content: The online photos don't do this hotel justice. We learned from the staff that it's classified as a "boutique" hotel, which has the comfy features of a B&B. It is charming, clean, nicely furnished, homey, spacious, and the breakfast was much better than average. The staff was very helpful and we hope to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Elm House Inn -Yes,Yes,Yes”
Reviews.Author: tootsdwales
Reviews.Content: Even with the help of Trip Advisor, it took me a long time to plan our trip to N. California. I was considering staying at Yountville- far too expensive and what a disappointment when I actually went there. (Did I miss something or is there really just that rip off bakery that has the nerve to sell coffee at over the top prices and then to expect you to drink it from a disposable cup, a couple of hotels and a few twee shops?) So I decided on Napa.The reviewers on Trip Advisor are all correct- The Elm House Inn is great! Large well decorated, spotlessly clean room, good size bathroom excellent continental breakfast- and those waffles! This was my first experience of home made waffles and I thought I would never manage a whole one- WRONG- they were so light and fluffy- delicious. Also cookies etc. in afternoon were very welcome. We tasted the wine on a Thursday p.m. and that too was excellent with plenty of tasty nibbles to help it down. Napa itself was a bit dead but an excellent centre for touring wine country. However it did have a selection of restaurants some of which we investigated (see separate reviews of the best and the worst) P.S. Copia is well worth a visit esp. for the gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sarahkaye23
Reviews.Content: As everyone says, it certainly isn't a typical Best Western. The service was great, the continental breakfast was more than adequate and the beds were really comfortable. However, for the price we paid (about $200/night in mid-August) you can get a bigger room in Napa, and we felt a little bit cramped in our third floor room in the main house.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ihearthomer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I did a road trip this summer and this was one of the most memorable places we stayed. We were in the new addition (room 405 maybe). The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. I will attach a photo. The area was peaceful and quiet, but convenient to the highway and close to downtown napa (which is undergoing a major renovation, but still has great restaurants--celadon & angele). The hotel also had a complimentary continental breakfast with waffles and oatmeal, and cookies in the afternoon. There was a computer with internet access and a printer for guests to use in the breakfast area. I would stay there again even with just a king bed to share, and tell others to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good value”
Reviews.Author: luvs2run27
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the non-hotel like feel of this chain establishment. It was very comfy, cozy and seemed to aim to make guests feel at home. The rooms were spacious and had thoughtful appointments, such as plush rugs in the bathrooms such as you'd have in your own home. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: scook102
Reviews.Content: It has been a couple of years since we first stayed here - 4 couples celebrating my 40th birthday. We are now planning a return visit this October '07. While doing some research on TripAdvisor, I was pleased to see that the Elm House is rated as #1 by fellow travelers for the Napa region. This is without doubt one of the best values in the area. We are looking forward to our return vist to this wonderful and quaint Inn which is centrally located in the region.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: DwightShrute
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House primarily because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. To sum it up, the reviews were completely accurate - we had an incredible time and the hotel staff, cleanliness, location, and value for what I paid couldn't have been better. The inn is a not your typical Best Western; it is more akin to a Bed and Breakfast. They serve waffles in the morning and have fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. at no extra charge - and they have trays to take items back to your room. For wine tasting - the front desk has free tasting coupons, maps, and their own recommendations of what to see - which was perfect for my girlfriend and I, as we were on our first trip to wine country. The inn is directly next to the Los Caneros area, which in my mind, had the best wine out of all the locations we tasted. The restaurants in the city of Napa (which is currently a small but rapidly expanding town) are perfect for a quick lunch (Downtown Joes) or fine dining (Celedon). If you need flowers for the room, I ordered the most beautiful roses from Floral Expressions and the hotel placed them in the room. All in all, Nice romantic location for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: masonla
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this cute place by calling the hotel directly. He got a much cheaper rate than doing it online. The pictures on the internet don't do this justice. It was adorable. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful. Luckily we were able to get in quickly at the last minute for a Saturday night. Breakfast was yummy, especially the belgian waffles. My only concern was the gal serving breakfast, she didn't smile and greet us when we came down in the morming...but maybe I'm just picky that way. =) Otherwise it was a very good stay. Comfy bed, great room, great hotel. We enjoyed it very much. Next time we'll take advantage of the Wine tasting. Woud stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Napa”
Reviews.Author: crepessuzette
Reviews.Content: Just getting around to writing ths review, partly in response to some of those that suggest the Best Western Elm House inn isn't a great place. We stayed there in the couple of days after Thanksgiving last year. It's not the most charming inn I've stayed at, and the breakfasts are not gourmet -- though they are plentiful and throughly good. The room we had at least was *very* spacious and included a fireplace and full sitting room area. The inn was quiet, sunny, and pretty centrally located. It took us about 15 minutes to get to downtown Napa, which we did a couple of times, ending up walking about the town a fair amount which we'd never done when we stayed elsewhere. Most important, in an area full of overpriced or super-tacky lodgings, this is neither. The breakfasts included fruits, cereals, juices (not fresh squeezed, but we were not paying fr. squeezed prices either) and a freshly made waffle. I found the room attractive in its decor and I loved the spaciousness and the fireplace. Plentiful free parking and helpful staff was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient!”
Reviews.Author: LKB113
Reviews.Content: Three stars but four stars for the uber comfy beds and the very helpful staff. Otherwise nothing that special, way over the top flowery decor - rooms cluttered with magazines about goings on in the area, small cute courtyard, a wine reception where you'd expect to sample a bottle of something really mid-priced like Ravenswood (which we did), a jacuzzi in the back. Expensive for what it is, but then again that's Napa for you. Personally when I return I'd take a chance on a newer boutiquey hotel with reviews that are not as good because I was simply uninsipred by the place. If anything it was just a place to lay my head, nothing about the property made me want to linger.

Reviews.Title: “what a surprise”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel in Napa. We booked our trip with less than a month to go, and there wasn't much left with B&B's (it was auction weekend). The reviews on this site were so impressive, we decided to stay here, instead of a B&B. It was a good choice. We got a huge room with a jacuzzi tub (ask for the new building) and they were most accommodating. The outdoor hot tub was a little dirty from the cover being on the ground - but that's minor. It's in a great location and it's a great value. We'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Totally agree!”
Reviews.Author: ocruisers
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several properties in different areas of Napa/Sonoma/ Healdsburg/Calistoga/Yountville and chose Elm House on the basis of the Trip Advisor reviews. We weren't disappointed. Our standard King was on the second floor of the main building and was a very pleasant overnight. As others have mentioned the breakfast is very good and a nice middle ground between continental and the full board B&B fare. There's wine and a nosh in the late afternoon - turkey foccacia sandwiches when we were there - and fresh baked cookies for the evening. Our bed was very comfortable with a featherbed over the mattress and feather pillows. Except that we have a down comforter at home, it felt like our own bed. Even though there was road construction occuring on surrounding streets, we were actually surprised at the quiet night and morning. First floor rooms look a little "busy", so suggest you request a 200, 300 or 400 (the outer building) room. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Sasco
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this lovely little Inn and two in a (much) more expensive and larger inn, and I would have been perfectly happy spending all four nights at Elm House. We had a deluxe king room in the new addition, which was very spacious and clean. The only downside was some traffic noise, but not too bad. Delicious complimentary breakfast - especially the Belgian waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ILUVFOOD
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful little place. We stayed in Room 403 which overlooks a nice garden. This was in their new addition. Huge room that was just perfect. I would highly recommend what really feels like a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: hipiechk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House for two nights in March. It was a pleasant surprise. We were trying to keep costs down and the Elm House was a good option for that. It is a cross between a motel and a B&B, which is nice. Our room was very large (we were in a deluxe room in the back house) and very clean. There were nice little amenities you don't find in most Best Westerns, but conveniences of motels that you don't always find in B&Bs. The breakfast was good - oatmeal, breads, fruit, coffee and optional Belgian waffles and the dining room was bright and comfortable. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Winner!”
Reviews.Author: Lolafromsocal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Elm House Inn, and our experience was wonderful. Breakfast waffles were great; the bed was really comfy; the room was quiet & clean, and we found the location to be fine. I was happily surprised to find a make-up mirror in the vanity area - a very nice touch. Seth was very helpful; all the staff aimed to please. Easy walk into town - plenty of nice restaurants. We chose this motel because of TripAdvisor, and were happy we did. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “The feel of a bed and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: travelerArizona
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Elm House March 22nd and 23rd, 2007, and were very pleased. Upon driving up to this Best Western, I questionned our choice, as the setting did not appear as the website showed, but any doubts we had were quickly erased. The service was impecable, room was comfortable and well equipped with coffee, even q-tips!, and all you'd expect from a better facitility. The breakfast was superb, with Belgian waffles upon request, which we found delicious, as well as juices, fruits, eggs, more breads than you could possibly savor. Fresh cookies baked in their kitchen were available all day, a nice touch. The conceirge was extremely helpful. It has a quaint fountain ourside as well as a patio. The price was lower than we expected for this area. Skip the Marriot, you'd never get the atmosphere you'd get at the Elm House! We booked directly with the hotel as it showed no availability through various travel websites.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: pjs2780
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our time at the Elm House Inn! My husband and I had only one day to stay in Napa during a recent visit to northern California, and the Elm House Inn made that day incredible. Check-in was easy (even though we arrived pretty early in the day, they were ready to accomodate us); we got a room in the new building, and it was incredible -- spacious, comfortable bed, clean bathroom, lovely garden view (and the parking lot was not scary at all). We couldn't have asked for more. We also really appreciated Rochelle's assistance with recommending wineries and restaurants, and all of the Napa literature (and passes to several wineries) she provided us -- we showed up pretty unprepared, but after 5 minutes with her, we had a plan for the day. We visited 4 of the wineries she suggested and found a new favorite (Freemark Abbey) and had dinner at Celadon, also on her recommendation. The front desk staff was flawlessly helpful; I really cannot say enough about them. After a great night of sleep in the comfy king-sized bed, we had a delicious breakfast (including Belgian waffles) before heading out to Yosemite. We would without a moment's hesitation stay at the Elm House Inn when we visit Napa again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything as expected”
Reviews.Author: JDavidHalifax
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Elm House (Feb 14 and 15) before heading out on our cruise to Mexico. Positive reviews on this site led us to this delightful property. Friendly and helpful staff, clean and well appointed rooms, great breakfasts on both mornings, free internet access, quiet common area and I could go on. While the following comments don't reflect on the Hotel - we did take Seth's recommendations on restaurants and did not enjoy either. Let me explain - We went to Porchellini's on Feb 14 - My wife fell ill about 30 minutes after eating and was in bed until 4:00 pm the next day. Yes - she missed the winery tours. The following evening we went to Cole's - while the steaks were tasty, we felt the menu was very overpriced. If we're ever back in Napa we hope Elm House is there to welcome us.

Reviews.Title: “YES, it is that good!”
Reviews.Author: opieluvCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what most of the reviews have stated already - practically perfect. First, the positives: CLEAN rooms and bathrooms, BEAUTIFUL atrium with a fireplace where you receive wonderful breakfast foods and coffee all day. The waffles are as good as you hear as are the oatmeal, bagels, juices, teas, cereals, etc., etc. You will be amazed at the breakfast as well as the service. It is like Mom is in the kitchen and she just knows when you are there! Whipped butter and warmed syrup just round out the perfect breakfast! YUM! You almost feel like you are in your home with a butler waiting on you. We had a smaller room in the main building with a queen bed and a corner fireplace. The room was small but just fine for two. The fireplace was gas and didn't offer much heat but did give nice ambience on such a cool and rainy weekend. The bathroom was cramped but offers an additonal mirror and sink just outside in the "closet" area and there is a fully stocked refrigerator with water, sodas, beer, etc. for a VERY NOMINAL fee. There is also a basket on the desk with snacks that you can purchase for $1-$2 each. NO PRICE GOUGING HERE!!! CONS: The ONLY major complaint I had was the noise from the street. You could hear the cars driving by and the sirens from police and ambulances that passed by. ALSO, minor disappointment in the fan in our bathroom. It was LOUD and made a very scary noise when first turned on. The water pressure had a lot to be desired as well. Other than that, it was ALL good! ****You might ask to stay away from rooms on the first floor, especially those right next to the breakfast area. CALL AHEAD AND REQUEST that you NOT get rooms on the first floor. One is even crammed in a tiny alcove about two feet from the elevator doors. The front desk was always helpful and because we arrived early they even stored and delivered our luggage to our rooms while we went out wine tasting. I am a travel agent and I have researched and booked many rooms in Napa but this will meet or beat ANY of its competitors on value and cleanliness any day. It is also VERY small so you never fight a crowd for breakfast or service. By the way, the newer building in back is where our friends stayed in the deluxe King and the rooms were HUGE- almost three times the size of ours. We were only about 10 - 15 minutes from the Silverado Trail's first winery and about 20 minutes from those above us on the 29. Since this is right on the 29, it is easy to find your way to either of those. DO NOT bother with the expensive eateries. Stay near the hotel and you will find plenty of offerings! This is a very cute hotel! You will not be disappointed! AND you will save enough money to buy that really great bottle of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Barry19
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting a typical Best Western experience at his hotel, you will be disappointed. This hotel is like no other BW we have ever stayed in. It felt more like a 4 star B&B in France or Italy. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The common areas were spotless and carefully maintained. The art work displayed throughout the property is impressive. The complimentary breakfast is satisfying. Most importantly, the staff is exemplary, always ready to offer assistance well beyond your expectations. All this for a fraction of other Napa valley hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aged_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We chose The Elm House Inn because of its excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. It was a really superb hotel with friendly, helpful staff, beautifully clean rooms, a varied and tasty breakfast, in fact we could find no faults with The Elm House Inn . Its location was convenient for touring the Napa and Sonoma Wine areas, It was easy to reach downtown Napa, where there were numerous restaurants, catering for all tastes and prices. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would certainly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tucson_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: After staying in this charming hotel (or should I say "bed and breakfast" as it resembled that more than a hotel), I absolutely had to leave a review. Tripadvisor is where I begin all of my planning and I haven't been let down yet. Everything that has been raved about this hotel is 100% true - I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Napa. Here it goes...first, the location is perfect. Within walking or short driving distance are spectacular restaurants - whether you are looking for a gourmet Italian restaurant or a great downtown joint to grab a late night dinner. On the coffee table in the quaint lobby is a book that holds all of the menus of some of the best restaurants that Napa has to offer. Seth, one of the front desk clerks/concierge was fabulous - he had a prepared list of recommendations of restaurants and wineries ready for us when we checked in and was so helpful in guiding us in the right direction and making reservations for us. And the room - where do I start? I had originally reserved a romantic queen room with a fireplace and was pleasantly surprised when we had been upgraded to the largest room in the hotel (which, by the way has only 22 rooms). It was a king deluxe room with a fireplace and jacuzzi tub - room 207 (you can view the actual room on the website). To make the room even more perfect, because of the way it was positioned in the inn, there were no rooms on either side of it or below it. Perfect. If you can snag this room, you will be just as pleased as we were. (My only bit of advice is to avoid room 104 simply because it is located right next to the breakfast area and you will undoubtedly hear every clink of every piece of silverware starting at 7:30 in the morning). And, speaking of breakfast, throw in a wonderful (included) breakfast each morning in the beautifully decorated lobby - how can you go wrong? I can't rave enough about this inn and I will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!!”
Reviews.Author: JOHANNE67
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in september. I found this place trough the reviews of TripAdvisor. What a beautiful place. Small, 22 rooms I think. Very cozy, the rooms were great. First night we had a Delux Room, which was in another building, we would of loved to keep it! It was soooo nice! For the 2 other nights we had a Standard room in the main building. It was very nice too. The staff was very nice and always there to help us find a restaurant for dinner!!! The breakfast, so yummy! The waffles, fruit salad...everything was very good. The hotel is also one block away from the main highway...very easy and 5 minutes by car from the little shop centers in Napa and 10 to 20 minutes for Yountville, Rutherford & St-Helena. I would return anytime! Johanne & Fabien Quebec City

Reviews.Title: “Love love love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: iamkokopelli
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Do I rave about the gorgeous room, the beautiful courtyard, the great staff or the 'extras' first? The room was amazing. I wish my home was this great. No awful hotel bedspread here! The bed was so comfortable, the bathroom was a dream bathroom and the chairs were comfy. The courtyard is well maintained and welcoming. The lobby felt like a grand sitting room. The staff was so friendly... they genuinely like being there. The extras: In season they have wine and snacks in the afternoons, cookies and cider/coffee in the evenings and yummy breakfasts in the mornings. Two words. Belgian Waffles. Cereal, bagels, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, juice etc. Right in downtown Napa, after dinner downtown an easy walk back to the hotel. I just hope I have a chance to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Had such a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Soriah
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews I read on TripAdvisor, and once again I was not disappointed. I got one of the larger rooms, and when I walked in the door, it was literally like entering a Versailles sitting room. The bed was huge and so soft, there was a nice-sized couch and desk, the TV was ample and there was even a fireplace and a couple chandeliers. The bathroom area included two separate rooms--one area with the sink and such, and then a door that led into the toilet and large jacuzzi tub. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. They always had the perfect restaurant suggestion or directions when needed. And everyone wasn't kiddindg about those waffles. I never thought I'd rave about waffles, but they had the perfect consistency and were so yummy! Since this is a smaller hotel, housekeeping was very attentive and I never ran into them still cleaning my room or experienced frustration at my room having not been cleaned yet. When I read the earlier reviews, I expected the parking areas to be sorta scary, but they weren't bad at all. There are parking lots on either side of the hotel, so there's always enough room to find a parking place somewhere. (Although keep in mind that the lot on second street opens up to a one-way street, so you might have to make a couple extra turns if you want to end up back on California.) I would definitely return to the Elm House Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Six-time "Best of the Best" Award Winner!”
Reviews.Author: donHeraldo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed at the Elm House Inn on several of our previous trips to Napa in years past, but as good as it was then, It has just gotten better! They have added a new extra-deluxe wing, a conference center, a large, circular outdoor jacuzzi, all new landscaping, and garden sculptures to their facility. Everything is upgraded, new and deluxe. The rooms, furniture, baths and linens are especially beautiful and comfy. The lobby is like a fine club. And the free breakfast served every morning in the lobby is worthy of the finest inns in the world! With only 22 rooms, and growing fame among visitors to the Napa Valley, you will need to book early, even in winter. But when you're among the fortunate priviledged few, you will sing their praises just as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Boston19
Reviews.Content: I was recently in San Francisco on a business trip and my parents decided to join me for a trip to the Napa Valley. The reviews were so good that I decided to see if it lived up to the hype, and it did! The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice and big, and the staff was incredibly kind and helpful. The continental breakfast can't be beat and their location to downtown Napa is fantastic. For the money, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: WMC08
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are true. Great location, great breakfast, comfortable beds. Not your typical Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaRhino
Reviews.Content: From the minute we gals (3) stepped in we were treated like family. Very small, comfortable and homey. Great cocktail hour and breakfast. The front desk staff were very helpful. Location good, easy access. Would definitely return. Trip Adviser comments were my deciding factor in booking this hotel and it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Quilt
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Elms is terrific. Our room was easily the largest hotel room I've ever stayed in and it was beautifully decorated, had a fireplace, and a jacuzzi in the tub. Morning breakfast -- hard-boiled eggs, cereal, fruit, breads, homemade Belgian waffles -- was simple but right on the money. Afternoon goodies included a wine tasting with terrific appetizers and home-cured olives! These people and their staff understand the business of hospitality. I'd make this my go-to in Napa. Note: two rooms enter directly off the dining room and I'd try to avoid them (rms 104 and 105).

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews Are True!”
Reviews.Author: Fonzmambo
Reviews.Content: What an incredible stay we just had at this lovely hotel (if you want to call it a hotel...it has more of a B&B feel to it)! Without rehashing all of the glowing reviews and information from previous reviewers, I will say that the room is one of the nicest I've stayed in: beautifully decorated, very roomy, separate dressing area with a sink, small refrigerator in room, wonderful sitting area, and lovely patio off of the room with a small table and chairs. It appears there are two buildings: the main building and the newer building which houses the "400" units. We stayed in the newer building so I don't know if the rooms are the same in the main. We went in the jacuzzi in the mid-afternoon and it was clean (although small) and situated in a lovely courtyard full of hummingbirds feeding on hummingbird feeders. The location was very convenient to the Wine Train and we were also able to access the Silverado Trail on our bikes from the hotel with relative ease. The continental breakfast was relatively average (I don't know if they were out of this incredible coffee other people raved about) but definitely suited our needs: bagels, english muffins, yogurt, cereal, oatmeal, fruit. We did not try the Belgian waffles although I know other reviewers strongly encouraged it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and, in fact, felt sorry to leave :(!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place We've Ever Stayed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The innkeepers have paid attention to virtually every detail. The room was comfortable, the extra touches were extremely thoughtful (when's the last time you ever stayed in a hotel/motel/inn with a night-light in the bathroom), and the staff was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable of the area. This inn and its staff are superior -- from check-in to check-out, the only sad part was leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: MumaRules
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews of Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. They served Belgian waffles every morning which was the perfect start to a day of wine tasting! The setup of the eating area was also conducive to meeting other guests and comparing notes of area attractions. And if you made it back to the hotel later in the day, they had home-made chocolate chip cookies and lemonade. Yum. The location of the hotel was convenient, we felt very safe and would definitely return if we were fortunate enough to be in Napa again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: gatordeb65
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent two nights at this hotel and can't stop talking about it! Though it is situated in a residential (and very quaint) area, once you enter you feel as if you're in another place. We stayed in the main building on the third floor and were extremely pleased with our room. It had a king size bed, a fireplace, large bathroom, refrigerator, snacks for sale, and cable tv......all things we looked forward to after long afternoons wine tasting. The complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings and the fantastic breakfast in the mornings just added to our already wonderful stay. (Whatever you do.....don't pass up the breakfast....the Belgain Waffles are awesome!) I picked this hotel based on the reviews I read on this site and I couldn't have been happier. The rooms are immaculate, the gardens are beautiful, and the staff was fantastic. The location is perfect, too. Close to Sonoma as well as Napa vineyards and within walking distance to the charming Downtown Napa area. An unbelievable deal.....we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the West”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Sarah
Reviews.Content: There is little to add to the detail that has been written here before. The hotel is located about 20 mins walk from downtown Napa which is a great place to eat out. The staff at the hotel are so friendly and on our first night Rochelle (apologies if we got this wrong!) sat us down with the hotels' big book of menus and some of her recommendations. We chose, she reserved and on our second night found she had secured us a table at Ristorante Allegria, The building housing this great Italian is an old bank and not only did she secure us a table we were located in the private dining room which is actually the old vault - very atmospheric and enough to make me come over all Butch Cassidy. Our room was in the second building on the ground floor and huge - we upgraded for a little extra but the space was great. Dressing area, large bathroom with separate shower and bath as well as a couple of arm chairs and plenty of space to store the wine you will doubtless buy. Went on a 2 day tour (split over a Thurs and Sat) with the Napa Wine Shuttle which was recommended by a previous reviewer and was excellent. Heartily recommend a vist to Clos du Val (their Pinot Noir is excellent), Raymond (such great guys) and Luna ( a Sangiovese to die for - at 15.4% too much and if not dead you will be anethestised!!) Final restaurant recommendation is the stunning Celadon in Napa - truly the best meal we had on our short (5 day) visit. Glad we only spent 5 nights here as we have the excuse to come back and are planning to return next year - wouldn't stay anywhere else. My wife has chided me for also failing to mention that Napa Premium outlets are about 4mins in the car from the hotel, but with all this food wine you must forgive a chap for forgetting about savings on yet more bags and shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: mpaden01
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Napa and stayed with my parents (in San Fran) for most of the trip. But we had planned just one night to stay in Napa. This was our first trip to the wine country and didn't know where to stay. I had read the reviews of Elm House and picked it based on the great reviews. When we arrived I was somewhat disappointed. It's in the middle of a residential area and didn't look like much from the outside. The people at the front desk were super-nice and let us drop off our luggage even though it was early and our room wasn't ready. When we had returned from our wine tastings, they had already put our luggage into our room. Our room was in the buildng next door and was huge. It looked brand new and had a large, gorgeous room and a great bathroom. I was thrilled with it and would recommend staying there. We didn't see the rooms in the main building, so they may be smaller. Our bed was incredibly comfortable and there were really nice touches, like the wine/travel magazines. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at Elm House even though it was only for a night. The breakfast place they had recommended was excellent -- I think it was called Goodwyn's and it's in downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great little retreat at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This little gem is only 15 minutes or so from St. Helena and 20 or so from Calistoga. The rooms are nice but not 5 star nice. They are clean, well-kept, and overall the best I've ever seen for a Best Western...by far. The staff are what make this place really shine. They are helpful, observant, and genuinely nice. They gave us great recommendations and we were SO glad we listened. I would also comment on the coffee...FIRST RATE! This is some of the BEST coffee I've ever had in hotel. I would highly, highly recommend the place. Plus, there's the obvious, it's a fantastic bargain. :)

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Beasley123
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Elm House is a surprising find in Napa. What a fabulous base for wine touring. Very friendly staff, fabulous full breakfast and lovely rooms all add up to a terrific hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Research Queen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our second weekend in Napa (this season) and I must say - I was VERY impressed with the Elm House. It is everything these positive reviews claim and much more! I made reservations just a few days before arriving, so I was given the only room available - the premium deluxe. Priced at $239, this room is WELL worth the extra money. The bathroom is huge and there are TWO sink areas (one in the main bathroom, the other in a dressing area)...ideal for those who like privacy and space when getting ready =) The room also has a mini fridge, sitting area and a very comfortable king size bed surrounding its lovely springtime decor. Another nice touch to the room is the fact it opens up to a cute little garden area. (Be sure to request the deluxe room on the second floor so you won't hear footsteps all morning/night). Yet another factor that made this stay memorable was the friendliness of the man at the front desk, Seth. I'd read about him on here and he truly is as wonderful as they say. Seth was kind enough to put together a folder of the wineries my boyfriend and I should visit and he included complimentary tasting passes, maps and other recommendations. He was extremely helpful, an exceptional employee. To be honest, I was worried about staying at a Best Western, but it was the only location available on such short notice. I am SO glad I decided to trust the reviews on tripadvisor and give the place a try. My boyfriend and I are DEFINITELY returning =)

Reviews.Title: “As good as they say”
Reviews.Author: hmabramovitz
Reviews.Content: I booked because of the great reviews and have to admit that we selected a great place to stay based on the recommendations on Trip Advisor. The staff was excellent. The room had a fireplace, which was very cozy. The only complaint is the the driving directions were difficult to follow, but once we found the hotel, we found it to be very welcoming and the staff is wonderful (esp. Seth). I was very surprised given that I don't typically hold Best Western properties in very high regard.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Napa valley”
Reviews.Author: M&MRochesterHills
Reviews.Content: This inn has to be one of the best of Best Western. A very pleasant inn that is charming, immaculate, with small but beautifully landscaped grounds. The service was friendly yet professional - especially Seth. Our room wasn't large but big enough and the fireplace was a nice feature. It was also a very nice of the Elm House to provide a computer with internet access so we could check our e-mail. All of this at a reasonable price-especially for Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Napa Valley for 2 days as part of a trip to the SF area. This hotel was great! The price was right, especially for the area. We booked on the BW website, and when we arrived at the hotel, we were given a free upgrade to a fireplace room! The room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed. Check-in and check-out were smooth. Seth at the front desk was fantastic! He gave us suggestions on wineries to visit and even gave us free tastings coupons. He also gave us suggestions on restaurants and even called to make reservations for us! Truly an outstanding employee. The breakfast was a nice touch, but could have used a bit more variety. The fireplace in the lobby was warm and inviting. We did not use the hot tub, but it looked nice. The hotel was so close to 29, where the action is and it was a convenient drive to everything. We wished we could have stayed longer! If we return to wine country, we will definitely be back to the Elm House Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: RichDe
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent 4 night stay at the Best Western Elm House. At first glance, we were a little concerned that the smallish building was set very near a major intersection. The main building seems to be an old house that has been completely rehabbed. This is no B&B. It’s better! This is as good as any full service, full hotel size we’ve stayed at. There are about 15 rooms in 2 buildings. As we first entered the building, we were relieved to find a bright well decorated lobby. Our room was average size, with comfortable beds. Everything was new and clean. A good vent fan and air conditioner drowned out most of the traffic noise. The comfortable lobby also doubled as an area for morning breakfast and afternoon wine tasting. The breakfast waffles and assorted fruits and cereals were great. The wine tastings provided were by local vineyards, a different one each afternoon. Cookies, coffee, tea and small sandwiches are available. Turndown service and mints were a nice touch. There’s a small nicely landscaped courtyard in the back, with tables and chairs and a spa. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. An advantage of being near a main road is that we had very easy access to Route 29, the main road into the vineyard area. We were also a few minutes from downtown Napa, about 30 minutes from Sonoma. If you’re not into the B&B or “quaint” Inn scene, this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice rooms, fantastic recommendations from staff”
Reviews.Author: RobLoganPortland
Reviews.Content: The Elm House was a revelation, considering it is a Best Western, and considering the price difference in other Napa Valley hotels. This feel much more like a B&B than a hotel, and we found our room to be spacious and comfortable. The only downside of this hotel is that the location is at the intersection of two fairly busy downtown roads. That said, noise was not a great issue. A gentleman by the name of Richard at the front desk was very helpful, and gave my wife and I two recommendations that really helped make our stay in Napa such a delight. First, was Ristorante Allegria, a fantastic Italian restaurant in a refurbished bank building in downtown Napa. Never would have found it on our own, and our canneloni and risotto dishes were spectacular in a great setting. Richard's second recommendation was to use the Napa Winery Shuttle for a tour of Napa Valley. The price was so low compared to some other tours that I was a little leery, but it was an absolutely fantastic day. My wife and I both know quite a bit about wine, but our guide was Norm (also one of the owners) and he showed us an amazing time at a diverse group of wineries. He had an answer for every question, and even made dinner reservations for 6 of us that met aboard the tour. It always means a lot to me when a hotel can be helpful with quality recommendations, and I will remember the Elm House fondly for sending us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “What expetert”
Reviews.Author: MellowLake
Reviews.Content: WOW! Recently, my husband and I stayed at the Elm House for our anniversary. When we got there they had homemade chocolate cookies for us and so much information. We traveled thru the wine country with ease. The woman on the desk provided us with many coupons and great directions. We had such a good time there. Josefina did a great job on the breakfast which had Beligum waffels and fresh blueberries. We highly recommend this place, it is not your typical Best Western. Dean and Ashley Rubins

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place/great value”
Reviews.Author: chgomember
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of place to stay in Napa. It exceeded my expectations and the pricepoint was a great value ($169 per night). The room was quaint and adorable (tiny bathroom though) and the staff was spectacular. I enjoyed the complimentary wine tastings in the evening complete with fresh edibles and savories and the continental breakfast was outstanding--fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereal, breads and made-to-order Belgium waffles. Rochelle (one of the managers) was amazing and gave great recommendations on fabulous places to dine in downtown Napa (ZuZu's for tapas and Pilar). I know I will return to Napa again and I already know where I'll be staying--at the Elm House Inn.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Elm House Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 800 California Blvd, Napa, CA 94559-2223
